Posted: February 29
PICO PARK: A Vision of Future Military Training

As a seasoned military drill sergeant, I am always on the lookout for innovative methods to foster camaraderie, communication, and collaboration among my recruits. Recently, I stumbled upon a video game that has proven to be an unexpected yet highly effective tool in achieving these goals - PICO PARK.

At first glance, PICO PARK may seem like just another cute and quirky indie game, but don't let its charming exterior fool you. This cooperative local/online multiplay action puzzle game offers a unique set of challenges that require strategic thinking, quick reflexes, and impeccable teamwork. With support for up to eight players, each level presents a fresh set of obstacles and puzzles that demand constant consultation and coordination among team members.

During our initial sessions with PICO PARK, I observed noticeable improvements in my recruits' ability to work together towards a common objective. For instance, during one particularly challenging level, we encountered a maze filled with moving walls and hidden traps. To navigate through this labyrinth successfully, the recruits had to communicate effectively, sharing their observations and strategizing in real-time. It was heartening to see them adapt quickly to changing circumstances, demonstrating remarkable resilience and resourcefulness under pressure.

Another level featured color-coded switches that needed to be activated simultaneously by multiple players. Initially, there were some missteps and confusion, but after several attempts, the recruits began working together more seamlessly, dividing tasks based on individual strengths and abilities. Watching them coordinate their movements and actions reminded me of a well-oiled machine, where every component played a crucial role in driving the system forward.

One memorable moment occurred when we reached a stage with disappearing platforms over a bottomless pit. Falling off meant starting over, so maintaining balance and supporting one another became paramount. In true soldier fashion, they devised a human chain formation, passing along keys and other essential items while ensuring no one fell victim to the treacherous abyss below. Their unwavering focus, trust, and determination shone brightly throughout this trial, reinforcing the notion that success hinges not only on personal skills but also collective effort.

Beyond strengthening team dynamics, PICO PARK has also helped improve problem-solving skills and creativity among my recruits. Each level introduces novel mechanics and twists that force players to rethink their strategies and explore alternative solutions. By encouraging lateral thinking and experimentation, PICO PARK provides an engaging platform for honing cognitive abilities in a fun, low-stakes environment.

In conclusion, I wholeheartedly recommend PICO PARK as a valuable addition to any team-building or leadership development program. Its clever design, diverse challenges, and emphasis on cooperation make it an ideal choice for fostering unity, communication, and critical thinking among group members. My recruits and I have greatly benefited from our time spent playing PICO PARK, and I am confident that others will experience similar rewards from incorporating this exceptional game into their training regimens.


PICO PARK excels at fostering teamwork and communication, making it an excellent addition to any team-building or leadership development program. Through engaging cooperative gameplay, players develop stronger bonds, enhance problem-solving abilities, and learn to adapt in dynamic situations – all vital skills for successful military training and beyond.

This is exactly what WoW progression raiding feels like but with 8 people instead of 20, play if you want to know exactly what it feels like to completely give up hope on the future of the human race. There was never any inkling, before this experience, that some dark force rules over those I share a discord server with. In fact, I consider many of them my closest friends. But after a few hours of this game with those men who I call my "homies," or "compadres;" I've learned that even the kindest hearts may be bound to truly twisted, hopeless minds. Aerospace engineers who can't figure out how to get off my head, computer scientists who can't block a lazer, and then there's me, a lowly humanities major stuck in the middle of the chaos, screaming for respite from the hopeless maelstrom of subtly acrid viscous stupidity that spun each and every one of these hopeless fools into a depth of fury not yet witnessed in this several years of friendship.

Posted: July 3, 2022
I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Posted: June 3, 2023
"Pico Park" is the game that will have you and your friends laughing until your sides hurt. It's a co-op puzzle game that requires teamwork, communication, and a lot of patience. But most of all, it's an absolute blast to play.

The game is surprisingly challenging, but in a good way. Each level feels like a new adventure, full of surprises and obstacles that will keep you on your toes. But at the same time, the game is incredibly silly, with characters that look like they're straight out of a cartoon.

The co-op mode is where the game really shines, as you'll need to work together to solve puzzles, use your different skills, and overcome challenges. But even if you mess up, it's hard not to just laugh it off and try again. You'll make some great memories trying to solve each level as a team.

If you're looking for a solo game experience, this might not be the game for you. While you can play by yourself, it's really designed to be played with others. Also, some of the levels may feel a bit unfair, as mistakes can result in having to start all over again.

Overall, "Pico Park" is a gem of a game that's perfect for a night with your friends. You'll laugh, you'll rage, and you'll make some unforgettable co-op memories along the way. Just be prepared for the occasional "accidental" push or shove.

Posted: 1 June, 2022
Don't be put off by the fact that this is an indie title with simplistic art style from a small developer. Perfect Heist 2 is a hidden gem carried by great execution, excellent performance and many great design choices that went into it.

Contrary to what you might think from the bank robbery theme, Perfect Heist 2 is not a guns-blazing-cops-vs-robbers team based shooter but rather a refreshing take on a team and class-based social deception game. The gameplay works very well for uncoordinated strangers but also scales well into advanced teamwork. While the game does have voice chat support, it's optional and no necessary to use (and in fact I never heard anyone on voice comms it in public matches, most people just use the chat).

What makes Perfect Heist 2 so special is the fact that the maps are full of NPCs walking around, going about their day. Your task is to blend in, use all kinds of distractions to have the cops chase around while the robbers slowly plunder the bank.

With default server settings teams are at more robbers vs fewer cops. For this reason robbers will only have one life each for the round, while cops get to respawn a limited number of times - unless they shoot a civilian, in which case they get suspended (means die for good for the round). As a result the robbers have a hard time winning open shootouts and therefore rely on stealth, deception and backstabbery by blending into the crowd of NPCs that populate the map.
Some of these NPCs are citizens, others are bank employees. These NPC types have areas assigned in where they are allowed to walk around. A citizen will not walk into the employee-only area and employees will not walk into the public area. To work around this you have to steal a disguise by knocking out a NPC and taking their clothing, in similar fashion to the Hitman series of games. Combined with walking around to act like an NPC and the fact that cops are not allowed to gun down innocents this makes for a very enjoyable social deception aspect.
I had a few moments in which I got nearly caught, walked around a corner, turned 180° and walked right back at someone who then wasn't sure if it's me or an NPC, since they are all over the place.

The real charm lies in the fun interactibles on maps. The goal is to steal money and carry it to a van. Carried money spawns a visible backpack on your back with money trailing out behind you. This means you either run for your life to drop off the money - or you try to sneak it out creatively.
Money comes from various sources. Some of it can be found as jewelry in glass-covered cabinets (smashing glass makes a noise, unless you have a class that can do it silently), some of it can be gained by hacking ATMs (which then show a red "HACKED" label and quietly drop a bundle of cash you can pick up or leave on the floor for a later attempt at picking it up), some of it comes from vaults (which you either have to blow open, drill your way into or hack your way into), some it comes from minor pickups like cash bundles or "secret files" you can find around the bank and the rest can be obtained through various class-related mechanics (such as hacking computers to install crypto miners, which give you passive income over time, or putting down a literal money printer hidden in a corner and letting it slowly print out cash you can collect later.).
You can set fire to plants to distract cops and open fire doors, you can sneak a bomb case into the bank to blow up the vault, you can blow up walls with various placeable explosives or use a drill to quietly cut through a wall or ceiling, you can climb on the roof, or climb into vents, or break windows to toss money out to pick up outside later, you can place all kinds of gadgets and use all kinds of abilities. The amount of mayhem in and around the bank is enormous and it makes it such a joy to keep the opposing team on their toes constantly.

What keeps the game fresh is the class and ability variety. You pick a class and really have to play its active skill and passive skill to your advantage. Some of these are pretty specific while others have more generic utility. Some classes can quickly climb up walls without making a sound, others can place guns or armor vests. Some can carry tiny amounts of money without spawning a visible money bag on the back, others can install protective or malicious software on computers. Some throw grenades, some shoot rockets, some use drones or bomb vehicles they can spawn, others can place walls that act like TV screens and broadcast a static image of the room behind (without showing any players, so they can about unseen). Some can obtain hidden information about the opposing team (such as class or locations), others place turrets, barbed wire or blockades. Some spawn VIP NPCs to protect (or to assassinate for rewards), others have a grappling hook. Some can set fire to block of hallways, others can set smoke or lethal gas traps. There are so many fun ideas put into classes, it creates ever changing variety and weird situations.

Perfect Heist 2 is built on the Unreal Engine. As the game uses a low-poly artstyle it runs exceptionally well, even on medicore hardware. Since it's Unreal, the netcode is also excellent for a gunplay oriented game. The amount of clutch shootouts you can have, especially unexpectedly when someone suddenly pulls a gun, is insane.
The game has a default FPS limit of 240 (which it easily reaches on a decent gaming CPU/GPU combo) but you can edit an .ini file to set the value to anything you want.

The only downside is the fact that the game is reliant on custom server settings to make each map enjoyable. That means an inexperienced host/admin might set up awful rules about respawns, required amount of money stolen or round timers that simply do not work very well with the particular map or play count. In this case you either have to use the server voting system and hope people vote to change it - or host your own server (out of the game on your computer or by using the official dedicated server tool on a machine of your choice).

The game has a map editor and Steam Workshop support, so given enough time and dedication, there will be ever more maps and content available.

All in all Perfect Heist 2 is an exceptionally surprising title sold at incredibly low cost. It's one of the better stealth and deception based games with shooter elements to come out of the past few years. Cops vs robbers just works so well as a theme, you will feel right at home.

Posted: 3 July, 2023
Usually I joke around when I leave a review but ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ this game is amazing in all ways. If you have a friend group to play it with I recommend grabbing it immediately, I have a total of around 10 people to play it with now by convincing more and more friends to buy it and we've been playing it almost every evening ever since.

The game's simple as a robber. Blend in, act like an absolute bot - literally - and pray that some innocent bank-goer will eat a bullet for you. Use the many different classes to blow up walls, hack PCs, disrupt the defending police and cash in. You're not in it for the money and prefer to spill blood? Valid playstyle, pick one of the more offensively playable classes and troll your friends with random gas explosions, mines or just snipe them from the rooftops.

The life of a cop aint as easy. You don't get any downtime as the robbers will always keep you on your toes, but at your disposal are superior firepower, tools to keep the robbers out of certain areas as well as things to help you track them down more effectively. Heard somebody around the corner opening a door? Use the detective's footprint recognition to find the rat. Is there a big group of NPCs and you're not sure what to do? Smoke em out with tear gas as Riot. Want your friends to hate your guts more than at the end of a mario party session? Play spy and blend in like the robbers would do, they will be too paranoid to make a move.

Don't like playing the "proper" way? There is no wrong way. Use the Firefighter's ladders supposed to be used to get high ground to instead block off hallways to annoy the living **** out of every robber trying to get past. Blow up the cops by utilizing an explosive RC car, because lets be real that's a thousand times funnier than blowing the vaults open. Or jump on top of Hornet's CCTV drone to fly around the map like a god. Infinite possibilities, infinite fun to have, infinite memories to make.

Don't let this games graphics and advertising fool you into thinking its a budget payday or generic throw away game. It's very basically if Payday and Hitman had a baby that follows the rules of Cops and Robbers. It has honestly way too many classes with their own playstyle that are pretty well balanced with most being memes and none that are overpowered. As for bugs I haven't seen many but there are a few very annoying ones. There was one whenever I tried to join a game it would just send me back to the mainmenu. I started my own lobby though and people joined just fine. Next day it was fixed.

Rules:

Cops: The cops very basically need to figure out who the robbers are and kill them but this is easier said then done since the maps are full of smart NPC's that the Robbers need to blend in with. Cops win when all robbers are dead or time runs out.

Robbers: As the name implies Robbers are trying to rob from whatever the map is set to. But this isn't a simple smash and grab job as the cops have much better weapons and multiple lives. So this mainly forces the robbers to blend in with the NPC's by stealing cloths that match which area they are in without getting caught. From there they either need to try and break into the vaults which usually have motion sensers, camera's, and fortified vault doors. Or steal alot of small things in the open. Either way though there's almost no sneaking out since once you pick up any money you are walking around with a suspicious bag that gives you away. Thats when you will probably have to shoot your way out and get to the getaway vehicles or hide it somewhere and wait for the right moment. Robbers win by either stealing a set amount of money or burning through all the cops's lives.

NPC's: Like the name suggests these are non playable characters that exist just to be a smokescreen for the robbers but if you think you can tell the difference between a NPC and a player who's pretending to be one you are dead wrong. Unless a player is carrying a money bag, pulls out a gun, Jumps/Crouch, or is wearing the wrong outfit in the wrong area you just cant tell. Its honestly really well programmed.

Posted: April 29, 2022
Fun game. Robbers play like PayDay 2 and cops play like Amongus. The team/objective elements are kind of like CSGO and the class based system is kind of like TF2.

The game is easy to learn and rounds are quick and the gameplay generally has a good pace. The community is small but friendly.

I bought the 2 pack for ~$12 and have gotten good gameplay hours out of PH2 (PH1 has no online players so I haven't really tried it much). I would recommend the game at this price point.

Works well under Steam Proton for Linux, have not tried native however.

Posted: May 19
We just played this on our 30+ LAN party, we had a lot (!!) of fun, despite only understanding a small part of the game.

We tried 2 maps, one seemed to be advantaged towards the cops, and the other towards the robbers. A lot of different classes and perks add quite some variability to the game and to the gameplay that need to be approached. This creates a relatively high replay factor.

I think I speak for all of our group when I say that this exceeded our expectations significantly. Definitely a go-to game for future LAN parties.

It's worth the 10 euros for me, so if you find it on sale it's definitely worth it.

The biggest downside is perhaps the amount of players online on public servers, but again, a strong recommend for LAN parties.

Posted: August 5, 2022
A cool little passionate game, which the Devs actually care about.

Perfect Heist 2 is a better version of Guess Who. Seek out the player among the NPC's as Cop or try to fit in as a Robber and steal the Money from the map your currently in. Hack ATM's or Arcades or blow up a Vault and try to shoot your way through, play how you want to play. Here and there are small changes and updates which show the devs care about the Game, even though it's low price. It might be difficult and overwhelming at first, but as you play more, you will understand the gamemechanics as there are alot of different classes to chose from with a different loadout. There to help you is the ingame Tutorial and for the creative, there is a Map-Editor which is supporting the Steam Workshop.
What is missing is actual Feedback about hits. While there are bloodeffects on hit, you never know if you truly hit an opponents Head or not and the Hitboxes feel really janky at times.
If you play a match with Bots, they wont count as real players. If you die on the robbers team while a bot is still alive, the game will end. Cop AI has a simular problem. Ability's that show player positions etc. will not show the AI.

Conclusion: It's better than Battefield 2042 in price and gameplay. Get it with a group of friends (about 4 players needed) and have fun.

Posted: June 21, 2022
Yes, I don't care if graphics aren't great, thats not what makes a great game. What is this game?

So... payday except where one team of players plays as the cops. So... cops and robbers except there's a bunch of AI neutral citizens that the robbers have to try to mimic their movement styles to "Hide in plain sight". So hide and seek payday, except with something like 50 classes to choose through (some for crooks, some for cops).

So, depending on how you work together and pick your classes, determines how well your strategy works against the other teams strategy, that you don't know about beforehand. And if you don't work together, you get this mix of who even knows whats happening against who even knows what they're using. Get enough money before the cops stop you. Don't shoot a civ if you're a cop. Robbers only have one life each. There's usually a pool of lives for cops, but don't waste them all. :D D: Woowoo!

Posted: September 7, 2022
Let me start by saying I was very skeptical about this game initially. The concept essentially being cops and robbers didn’t seem like a very compelling basis for a game for me. I was completely and utterly wrong. This game has taken over my friend group’s lives. When we get 5+ people together one of the first things we think about playing is Heist and it only gets better as those numbers go up. Honestly I think this is one of the best multiplayer games I’ve played in some years as its replayability is through the roof.

My only gripe is that playing online with randoms isn’t that fun, but I think that’s simply because there’s no banter like there is between friends. Ultimately I would recommend this game for any gaming group of 5+ if you like the theme, the concept, or just the idea of tricking and killing your friends while pulling off a bank heist.

In conclusion, good game good.

Posted: March 2, 2022
classes:
the game has a huge amount of classes for both police and robbers which make every round different and changes your tactics and your enemy's tactics
police:
playing as the police is usually a waiting game but when you hear an alarm a glass break or a door open it's always exciting to go check what happened and try to find who the robber is
robbers:
playing as a robber is usually about blending with the npcs until you attack, it's usually at its best when you take risks and fight the cops
combat:
the gunplay in the game isn't very satisfying or fluent but it gets the job done and the classes abilities build on top of it and make it interesting and fun
map maker:
the map maker is one of the best map makers i've seen, it lets you work fast but also get into detail, and you can make almost everything you see in the official maps

Posted: May 23, 2021
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
The obvious comparison is Among Us, but this game improves on all of Among Us' shortcomings. The tasks are more fun, the map is nicer, the cosmetics are wonderful, built-in roles and modes add far more depth to the game and do not require mods, built-in proximity chat for private games. The game is adorable, the humor is fantastic, and really I could just keep going on and on with positives about this game.

Unlike Among Us, I actually don't mind playing this game solo because the lobbies seem full of interesting and polite people, the games are fun, and the collection of coins to buy more cosmetics (plus the collection of components to build things) gives me incentive to keep playing. Best of all, this game is free. I did buy a coin bundle to support to devs - that is how much I adore this game. Play it! You wont be disappointed.

The only Amogus "rip-off" that is actually good if not better than Amogus itself. It looks better, plays better and has more features which adds more variety to the gameplay than just "either the impostors wins or the crewmates". Goose Goose Duck has many roles that you can choose to have in your game or not. It gives the players a different approach instead of just doing the tasks and win. There are many more things I can note that makes this game more fullfilling and fun but to put it all in short. This is basically the Unofficial Among Us 2

If you are bored with Among Us I'd highly recommend you guys trying this one out

Posted: August 28, 2022
If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Just downloaded the game a few hours ago to try out some new games in my spare time and came across this gem. Prox. chat enabled lobbies along with text chat only lobbies balance out and give the player a more comfortable experience. The ability to level up your character creating interesting styles and unique traits for your goose is great. The ability to leave a game, where you may not connect with the other players and find a new lobby immediately is a good option. Players have for the most part been friendly, so if you wanted to play a game to find new friends, I would 100% give this one a shot.

Hope this helped! :)

Posted: April 5, 2022
UPDATE: Gaggle staff has been a big help to fix an issue that has been plaguing me specifically which made me unable to play the game. Even going as far as requesting outside help to get it done. While i still have a hard disagree with their core development philosophies, I can respect that I've been wrong on how they treat others, because it isn't only bad interactions, it is good interactions too.
___________

I've played this game a lot, and looking at this game from just a gameplay perspective, I love it for what it is. For a Among Us clone, this plays well, is quite polished and gets regular updates.

HOWEVER, the reason I cannot recommend this game are the developers. Quite frankly, they lucked their way to the current state of the game and depend on the playerbase buying into their gimmick incentives for gameplay. They then ban you on their public forums for pointing this out to them, because they have an apparently huge ego.

If you want an example, the Mechanic Goose role is a role that can use the vents of the maps, so an Engineer from Among Us mods. This role is, for some reason, immortal while venting and encourages the player to just sit in vents all game long, effectively making the vents for the Impostors completely useless as they will get caught. It also denies the Pigeon role their win condition, because the Pigeon needs to infect each player during one round to win, which they cannot due to a Mechanic Goose just sitting in vents all game. It also makes it frustrating for Geese to win because they need to complete tasks to win, but many Mechanics just don't do this. It is a terribly implemented role, and when I brought this up for the second time, I was told I have "a lot of strong opinions", which is an arrogant answer to the concern of a player.

Not to mention, they have roles whose sole purpose is to give you 2 or 3 more coins for completing an objective, and coins are used to purchase cosmetics. The issue is that most cosmetics need 1k+ coins to unlock and in worst case scenarios, these coin roles have an incentive to completely throw games just for these few coins, while just being worse roles than roles without an ability. A few Impostor roles are also just worse than a regular Impostor.

Their inability to receive feedback that isn't praise is clear as day to me, and because of this I cannot recommend it, despite playing the game. And that's because there simply isn't an alternative to this game.

Posted: November 21, 2021
Product received for free

Goose Goose Duck is the game to go to if you liked Among Us but wanted more. While Among Us had one gamemode, three maps, and spent all it's time on one big map, Goose Goose Duck has several maps with several different tasks, five different gamemodes, a good multitude of roles, including neutral positions and many different ways to play the game that exercise different skill sets. Not only that, it is constantly updating, so new gamemodes, maps, and roles are coming.

Posted: April 30, 2021
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
I've been playing this game more hours than Steam lets on. The obvious comparison to Goose Goose Duck is Among Us, but where Among Us felt old after a few rounds, I can't stop playing Goose Goose Duck. So many options for geese(good guys) and ducks(killers) has each round exciting for everybody in the match. Instead of starting each round hoping to only be killing people, any of the roles feels useful and exciting. No longer can you just look for suspicious people to vote out. Now you're wondering "Was that guy in the vent on my team? Did I just watch a Vigilante(good guy role) use his only kill to kill another killer? Was that even a vigilante at all or just a killer pretending?" As soon as you think you have the round and the characters figured out, a whole new way of using them pops up and surprises everyone.

TLDR; The game is free and amazing. Literally no reason not to download

Posted: April 23, 2022
If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Just downloaded the game a few hours ago to try out some new games in my spare time and came across this gem. Prox. chat enabled lobbies along with text chat only lobbies balance out and give the player a more comfortable experience. The ability to level up your character creating interesting styles and unique traits for your goose is great. The ability to leave a game, where you may not connect with the other players and find a new lobby immediately is a good option. Players have for the most part been friendly, so if you wanted to play a game to find new friends, I would 100% give this one a shot.

Hope this helped! :)

Posted: October 14, 2021
If you think it's a knock off Among-Us, no that's wrong. This is what among us WISHES it could be. It's got all the modes you normally have to mod in, the prox chat you wish they would add by default, seasonal events and sooo much more.

Pros:
Better animations
Cleaner artstyle
WAY more unique tasks
Servers aren't getting hacked
Dead Memes aren't made of geese

Cons:
Prices in the shop are a bit steep. Plan to spend at least 10+ hours for some of those items
People WILL DC if they can not maintain a stable internet connection. There is no rejoin button.

Overall it is insanely fun when you have a chill group of people who are willing to take things as a laugh.

Posted: January 9, 2023
Connectivity and audio issues aside, I hosted a public room which led to some players being voted out (including me) for not speaking Chinese. Some of them were also swearing and being rude in Chinese, knowing the rest of us couldn't understand. I know this because a friend of mine watching the session speaks the language.

It would be nice if there was an in-game feature to remind/restrict language use to the host's or something, but judging by the dev's response to my feedback, it seems that they think I care about my content (by indirectly saying I should manage my lobby better) rather than improving the game experience for everyone (especially because there are kids playing too).

I thought this would be a fun game for all ages, but considering how many times I've heard people being toxic in the public rooms, I wouldn't recommend this game for children or the soft-hearted.

Well Its easy to learn I would say, but maybe not for everyone, since I watched a lot of my favorite people play this game, but when you learn more about the game and the functions and roles, its easier,

and yes many servers may have people who are very touchy on age like 18+
'kick this person because their a kid' or 'kick this person their voice is annoying'
(some here do have high voices)
even if those servers didn't say anything about an age restriction and everyone is warned before joining a game, if they read the warning they know the consequence for joining but still,
The game can get boring sometimes when someone isn't doing their task or they keep calling meetings, so the game wont end,
And Sometimes when you die, the game lasts forever but their is no tasks for you to at least do that can get annoying, truly
While people use mics and people use chat, a lot of Mic users don't read the chat for the ones who don't use mics (Maybe they echo), children who want to have fun but the server is picky with age, or they just like using chat.
that can get frustrating. even if your in a situation and your getting blamed but they wont read chat and that is what you just use.

but besides that we have a daily reward type structure, events happen so we can possibly get new items or even clothes. we can customize ourselves and our backdrop, friend people, and get some pretty interesting things for badges like Dapper, one of my favorite badges.

Like most who play Goose Goose Duck, I began by playing Among Us! It was not long into playing I met others and began playing with VoiceChat, then began playing the modded versions of Among Us - before I knew it - regular/no voice Among Us suddenly seemed stale and lifeless.

And then I heard about something called 'Proxy Chat', which means you can talk to other players while you are on the ship, but only if you are within eyesight of someone/within their proximity. There is a program you download separate from Among Us that allowed you to use this feature... but unfortunately it was very buggy, unstable, and would never work, resulting in many people just repeating "can you hear me?" or "I cannot hear anyone."

THEN GOOSE GOOSE DUCK GAME ALONG! Goose Goose Duck takes the gameplay of Among Us, mixed with the modded versions of Among Us and offers Proxy Chat IN the game, itself! This game offers the best of all worlds that have been inspired by Among Us!

You can play with 16 people in a game. It features many roles like; Sheriff, Vigilante, Assassin, Mechanic, and one of my personal favourites, Canadian. It has the built in and very stable Proxy Chat and automatically mutes ghosts who are then only about to hear each other. You earn in game money and crafting materials by doing tasks which you can use to purchase or craft new outfits, pets, and other silly things. It has other random options that Among Us doesn't like; the option to start every player in a random part of the map instead of bunched together around the emergency button, different game modes like 'Goose Hunt' that is basically Hide&Seek, lobbies with zero time limits so you no longer need to worry about your room cancelling out while waiting for someone to join, the ability to fart, and more!

Now that I have learned Goose Duck, I am not sure I can ever go back to Among Us! Oh, and Goose Goose Duck is FREE!

Posted: January 6
Product received for free

Personally I don't have a lot of hours in this game compared to others but this is still probably my most played game on steam. I have been playing since Black Swan was new and I have tried to follow the game ever since with some of my friends and overall, it's a great game that you should at least try. And yes, it is basically among us, but the game offers a lot of variety to it in the form of roles which have gotten pretty crazy over every update. This makes the game very repayable for people who came from among us and offers a lot of unique gameplay. The biggest problem with this is that for new players it CAN be confusing and it is definitely recommended to look at the tutorial before you start so that you aren't bumbling your way through matches. The game is also filled to the brim with achievements so if you are achievement hunting... good luck xd. And overall the game is enjoyable and was able to keep my few braincells entertained for over 300 hours with no expense, so at least try it if you like social deduction games. The only thing I'd recommend is to NOT TAKE THE GAME SERIOUSLY since this is a very goofy game that is filled with children. I couldn't count how many 18+ lobbies I have seen so that they could avoid people who don't take the game seriously and it can really dampen your opinion to watch yourself get voted for absolutely no reason so just play with friends that you trust or just let go and have some mindless fun.

Posted: September 28, 2021
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
Goose Goose Duck, a free alternative to Among Us, and a pretty impressive one at that.

Before I downloaded this game and first gave it a go, I was under the impression that it was basically just Among Us at its core, and to be perfectly honest, it looks like it on the surface, but oh, just you wait until we get to the tasks.

There's a lot more tasks to go through, some more original than others, and that's a good thing.
Player count maxes at 16, which is a step up compared to Among Us' new 15 player limit.

The more you play, the more you get coins for other cosmetics, so you don't have to pay a few dollars, which is good.
Only downside is that you'd either need a Google or a Gaggle account to actually play the game, but this doesn't really bother me too badly - playing just from a Steam account alone has its advantages and disadvantages.

Aside from the one complaint, Goose Goose Duck is a fun Among Us-styled game that I would personally recommend, especially when you can't be arsed to shell out five bucks.

Also farts.

Posted: June 20
I have over 1500 hours played in this game and have played it since mid 2021, and I have to say I'm beyond disappointed in what Goose Goose Duck has become. I was already really annoyed at the high cost of purchasing most items in this game, during such a difficult economic time and didn't think it could possibly get worse, but here we are. I don't think I've ever seen a game with the in-game/app purchases being so bad.

I had about 40k silver saved up to buy things in the store, and over 60 gold to save up for either a pet or a pair of eyes. This took MONTHS of game play to save up. In this new system, with my 40k silver, I got almost all junk items I'd never spend those silver coins on, in a gamble because the machine prize pools are massive. With my gold I only had two shots on the 30G machine, one gave me an outfit I would never in a million years buy for myself as I'm not very comfortable with it, and the other I got a hat item that's been there since the beginning and deliberately never bought. I also got a lot of duplicate items that gave very little dust, and my dust rewards from all that silver reached a bit over 1k, which will buy me hardly anything in the new store that consists of old shop items. I don't even want to imagine how long you'd have to play in order to get anything decent, but that's probably the point, to encourage you to buy more. You could spend a fortune gambling in this game and still never get what you're after with the new machine setup. This game is not at all what it used to be at the beginning and it looks like it won't be again. What a shame.

Sure, the gameplay might still be free, that's great for those who want to get together every now and then to play. But that'll only please people temporarily. Long-term players that have supported this game for years, like having goals, and in this game those goals are cosmetics, which has been taken away unless you're willing to spend a fortune on gambling. I'll never understand decisions like these to change what isn't broken and ignoring things that are for the sake of money. Instead of encouraging more people to buy from you by making more reasonably available to more people to buy, you drive away those that normally would buy what you're offering and completely scare away everyone else.

March 2022 Edit:
I was aware of the certain pay to win elements the game had in the past, but it was never that bad for me until recently where every single lobby i join have at least one with a pay to win advantage..
to those who don't know, there are 2 paid emotes in the game that you can use to kick or punch other players which provides a huge advantage
you can easily abuse the punch in stages where you have to stand still or avoid some hazards like lasers, and you can abuse the kick emote to push yourself forward after double jumping
i used to face people with these like once every 15 matches or so, which was fine
but now that they're in every single lobby i can no longer recommend the game unfortunately.

------------------------

A fun Fall Guys: Ultimate Knockout clone, but still needs some work
I'm gonna go ahead and list some of the stuff that i personally think needs improving:
- The music lacks variety and gets repetitive real fast (i was sick of it less than an hour in)
- Map selection screen is buggy, sometimes it goes too fast, sometimes it goes too slow, sometimes it ends in 3 seconds and other times it takes a lot longer
- There is no escape menu once you're in a server, so there is no way for you to check settings or leave game
- Some bugs here and there
- Needs more content to keep people interested
Overall its not too bad for a mobile game, and it should be worth a try once it goes F2P like the devs said in a previous announcement.

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead, murdered by my brother-in-law Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, Hank came to me with a rather, shocking proposition. He asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using his connections in the drug world. Connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded, I... I always thought that Hank was a very moral man and I was... thrown, confused, but I was also particularly vulnerable at the time, something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin so I agreed. Every day, I think back at that moment with regret. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Gustavo Fring, a businessman. Hank essentially sold me into servitude to this man, and when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling out. From what I can gather, Hank was always pushing for a greater share of the business, to which Fring flatly refused to give him, and things escalated. Fring was able to arrange, uh I guess I guess you call it a "hit" on my brother-in-law, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured, and I wound up paying his medical bills which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge, working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring, and did so. In fact, the bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen in the ranks to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA, and about that time, to keep me in line, he took my children from me. For 3 months he kept them. My wife, who up until that point, had no idea of my criminal activities, was horrified to learn what I had done, why Hank had taken our children. We were scared. I was in Hell, I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, to end this nightmare, and in response, he gave me this. I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. I... All I could think to do was to make this video in hope that the world will finally see this man, for what he really is.

Posted: January 30, 2023
Stumble Guys feels like a child of Roblox and Fall Guys, with difficulty mode toned down to easy. And even if people call it a cheap rip-off, it somehow works and is fun to play.

+ Some levels are even better than these in Fall Guys. Hot Wheels level was so fun to play, and so the watersliding one. I wasn't expected to have that much fun playing these

Dollar Store Fall Guys but actually decent quality and not ruined by Epic gutting the dev team and actively making the game worse. Seems to be a mobile first title, at the very least in UI elements of the main menu. Didn't even see a quit button and had to Alt-F4. Physics are acceptable, game variety pretty good. All these cross over deals and I even saw merch while walking around in Walmart before but it seems not a ton of that revenue goes back into the game in terms of polishing things up. Music loop isn't clean(I can personally hear a pretty clear stop and start as it loops), not a ton of variety in the tunes, the skybox is straight out of ToonTown Online without upping the resolution. To compare this to peak Fall Guys, it's like FG was polished up with a fine polishing compound and Stumble Guys got a pass with 400 Grit sand paper and sent out the door. I would like to see some more fun physics interactions and more than just jump and dive. Maybe bring it up to 64 person matches. Recommended because its still decent.

Posted: 18 March
epic game but gets kind of boring if you play it too much, here is some suggestions to make the game better.

Level Editor: lets you make your own levels and play them, could also choose which maps to play and which ones to keep out.

More Level features: jump pads, portals, boxes (physics), turrets, lazers, tesla coils, etc.

extreme mode: same levels, but with added hazards (got this idea when playing on the map with the 2 orbiting circles and placing a tesla coil on both of them, instead of fighting me and my brother tried to see who survived longest)

workshop levels: lets you download other peoples levels.

gamemodes: King of the hill, capture the flag, tag, etc.

more customization: such as hats, faces, textures, body-shapes, and animations (ex: top hat, frowning face, rocky texture, square shape, and rolling animation)

online match-making: everybody wants this.

select-able random skills: lets you toggle skills you want and don't want when using random (if you don't want growth/shrink ray when using random, you can toggle them off.)

more skills: duh.

customizable gameplay: lets you change stuff while playing such as gravity slider, faster/slower skill reloads, faster/slower movement speed, jump hight, etc.

add health option: everybody has lives, so when they die, they respawn but with one less life. (respawn skill just lets you save lives)

some form of single player: mabye survive waves of enemies, or try to survive in a level where every 10 seconds a new hazard spawns in.

organizable skills: skills can be categorized by movement, offensive, defensive, or misc.

levels: mabye add a campaign where you unlock skills as you go through, and have to change them before every level, defeating enemies, and parkouring your way to next level.

thats about it, hope developer sees this and considers some of the ideas.

My son (10 yo) and I (40 yo) played together. We messed around with many different abilities. Including the time stop ("za warudo"), the beam, shrink ray, grow ray, and revive. The controls are smooth, tight, and responsive. The maps change every round. And the balance of abilities changes with the maps. Out of 20 matches, we cracked up laughing at least 10 times. Especially the last round where my son used time stop, hit me with beam, but then we both revived and only I survived because my revive was on land while his revive was on top of land that got beamed into the ocean. The amount of abilities that all feel brokenly over-powered, yet somehow balanced, is mind blowing. If you appreciate game design - you are in for many treats.

Posted: November 24, 2023
Product received for free

They just don't make em like this any more.

Bopl Battle is a innovative and fantastic game in that it doesn't try to be more than it is. These days every game needs to have fifty skins for each character, strict line ups for balance, balance patches, carefully coordinated structure, preparation for potential esports, so on.. so forth.
And while many of these things aren't bad, they're often added at such priority that they bog down development or get in the way of other things.

Bopl Battle is a couch battler, ala Smash Brothers, and doesn't try to be anything else.
Unlike Smash Brothers and most other games in the genre, Bopl Battle doesn't try at all to confine you, in fact, it tries to enable you to break the game.
With modular power sets, multiple abilities, and combos and ability interactions abound all across the board in both expected and sometimes unexpected ways, Bopl Battle invites you to sit down with some friends and duke it out without caring too much about the result.

It's a pvp game that doesn't try to be competitive, it's not about the win, it's about playing the game itself and having fun with it.

A serious breath of fresh air in a genre choking on its cameo-focused fighter games and esports.

Posted: December 9, 2023
In my earnest opinion, Bopl Battle is one of the most innovative and creativity-inducing games of this year (along with Tears Of The Kingdom and Baldurs Gate 3).

Bopl Battle is fun, enraging, hearty, and makes you think outside the box. In Bopl Battle, there are endless amounts of combos and scenarios that you can come across or think of. The pure satisfaction of hitting a clever trickshot or outplaying your opponent with some crazy combo you thought of just gives me the feeling that no other game has brought me. This game has almost no flaws. The music is awesome, the graphics are very nice and stylized, and the gameplay is pretty smooth. The only thing it lacks is player count and multiplayer, which, to be fair, is hard to do as an indie developer with not too many funds.
Overall, I would 100% recommend buying this game and hopping on with a couple of friends to have the time of your life. 10/10

Posted: March 3
If you have a group of friends (or even just one) to play with, this is one of the most fun multiplayer games in decades. Not even kidding.
It's like the perfect blend of Smash Bros and Worms.

My friends and I have played a few times a week since it came out, and no signs of stopping.

If the dev reads this, please please please keep supporting the game however you can. Little bug fixes are awesome, but adding new maps or somehow a map maker or game mode editor would be insanely awesome. Maybe a way to edit which weapons are allowed before a match, etc.

The game is already so much fun, but has infinite potential. This game needs to blow up! The definition of a hidden gem.

Very fun multiplayer game both in local co op and online. Choose 3 different abilities out of many to battlle others with satisfying gameplay, cute cartoony visuals and sound effects causing endless laughs and fun. It's great in short bursts or slightly extended sessions if you mix things up every so often in the match, as you can quick swap abilities between rounds. Using the random ability option also adds a different level of fun as you don't know what mixture of abilities you will get to use. Definitely recommended if you are looking for an amusing multiplayer game to play with family and/ or friends. It's very easy to learn, looks cute and entertaining, and is just fun all round.

Posted: July 26
Bopl Battle: A Frenzy of Fun and Chaos

Bopl Battle delivers a delightfully chaotic and highly entertaining multiplayer experience that will have you and your friends in stitches. This couch/online game puts you in control of goofy slimes, battling it out in the most imaginative and unpredictable ways.

Gameplay and Mechanics:

The essence of Bopl Battle lies in its wild and unique abilities and weapons. Players can squish and splatter each other using an arsenal of inventive tools, from rocket engines that send platforms flying to black holes that swallow the entire stage. The creativity in the game mechanics is unparalleled, offering endless combinations for players to explore.

One of the standout features is the ability to invent your own strategies. Whether it's attaching a rocket engine to a platform, creating flammable smoke, or using a growth ray to permanently enlarge objects, the possibilities are vast. The ability to stop time and set up deadly scenarios adds another layer of strategy, making each match a thrilling and unpredictable affair.

The team vs team mode takes the fun to another level, encouraging cooperation and coordination to execute even wilder combos. The game's flexibility in strategy creation ensures that no two battles are ever the same, keeping the gameplay fresh and exciting.

User Interface and Features:

Bopl Battle's interface is intuitive, making it easy for players to jump right into the action. The visuals are bright and colorful, perfectly complementing the game's whimsical and frenetic nature. However, a notable disclaimer is the presence of flashing lights, which may not be suitable for players with photosensitive epilepsy or other similar conditions.

The game is designed for multiplayer enjoyment, whether locally or online. The requirement for controllers when playing locally (as only one player can use keyboard and mouse per computer) might be a minor inconvenience, but it's a small price to pay for the sheer fun the game offers.

Multiplayer Focus:

It's important to note that Bopl Battle is strictly a multiplayer game, with no single-player mode or bots available. This design choice underscores the game's emphasis on social interaction and shared enjoyment. Whether you're bringing friends over for a couch gaming session or using the built-in online matchmaking, the game ensures that you're always battling against real players.

Conclusion:

Bopl Battle is a fantastically fun and chaotic multiplayer game that shines with its imaginative abilities and strategic depth. Its quirky gameplay and endless combinations of tactics will keep you and your friends entertained for hours. While the lack of a single-player mode and the need for controllers in local play may pose minor limitations, the game's overall experience is overwhelmingly positive. If you're looking for a game that promises laughter, excitement, and a good dose of friendly rivalry, Bopl Battle is an absolute must-play.

Posted: November 16, 2023
Visually, 'Bopl Battle' is a treat. The characters burst onto the screen with vibrant animations and distinctive styles, making every encounter a visual spectacle. The arenas, inspired by iconic settings, provide the perfect backdrop for the impending wordy showdown, each one teeming with interactive elements that keep the battles dynamic.

Gameplay in 'Bopl Battle' is a frenetic dance, where players engage in fast-paced, adrenaline-pumping brawls. Forget traditional attacks – in this game, characters unleash a barrage of unique moves and power-ups, turning each confrontation into a wild display of chaos. The controls are intuitive, allowing players of all skill levels to jump in and wreak havoc.

Multiplayer mode in 'Bopl Battle' is where the game truly shines. Engage in intense battles with friends locally or challenge fighters from around the world in online matchups. The dynamic arenas and ever-evolving landscapes keep the gameplay fresh, ensuring that every match is a new chaotic adventure.

Bopl Battle is not just another brawler; it's a celebration of chaos and a testament to the creativity that can be unleashed in the world of gaming. With its innovative approach to the fighting genre and a multiplayer experience that is as competitive as it is exhilarating it exceeds expectations with the greatest piece of media to bless our existence

Posted: June 11
Bopl Battle is a lot like Stick Fight: The Game and if you like that, you should play this. If you haven't, Bopl Battle is a 2-D fighting game with many cool abilities, which are: Dash, Bow, Gust, Growth Ray, Shrink Ray, Blink Gun, Throw, Pull, Black Hole, Meteor, Teleport, Drill, Revive, Missile, Thruster, Mine, Boulder, Roll, Platform, Time Stop, Tesla Poles, Grapple, Spike, Grenade, Smoke Grenade, Invisibilty, and Beam. (Might have missed 1 or 2) You can also choose a random option which gives you a random ability every round. You can choose 3 abilities to use in the game and can change the settings to make it 2 or 1. The game is about using combos with these abilities to eliminate your opponents, that be by dashing up to high ground, making a platform and shooting at them from above, or by connecting all the islands with Push and Growth Ray and using Roll to spin around all the islands, crushing your enemies, or by growing yourself by bouncing the Growth Ray off the water onto yourself and using 2 Revives to clone yourself, giving yourself more of you to eat your foes. You can play with up to 4 friends, whether that is on the same device or using LAN. The only big thing that is annoying is that you cannot host or join lobbies. So either have friends over, or near you with their own device and play using LAN. Overall, this is an amazing game with laughs and good times. A good thing is that the game is still being changed constantly, so there is still room for more unique abilities and hope for online. So if you like 2-D fighting games like Super Smash Bros, Worms, Rounds or Stick Fight: The Game, Buy this. My personal opinion: this is the best of all of them.

review:
Posted: November 17, 2023
Intense and high speed fights. This is what lures you in. Abilities are thrown across the screen, platforms are flying around and explosives are exploding. There is never a dull moment.

The number of abilities you're able to combo together is what makes you stay. Each of them unique and with different benefits and drawbacks, enabling you to find a play-style of your own liking. Try to find the best counter to whatever silly strategies your friends (enemies!) are doing, or just do your own thing.

The game is snappy and visually pleasing ;) Music is catchy and sound effects are on point. This game is very fun.

Posted: September 23
As fun as it is tilting - Bopl Battle is a really engaging, chaotic game where there's a lot of fun to be had, and a lot of chaos to sow and reap. A word of warning, though, not only is this best with real friends - if you're of uneven temperament, i would advise against this. It's very easy to get enraged by the game if you die a lot in a row, or run into a particually cheesy combo. That's just the nature of things like this, so bear that in mind if that would bother you. It's also a little much for what it is IMO, though if you've got friends it'll likely be worth a lot more to you.

Posted: August 19
Extreme polish for this kind of game, especially for a 1 dev team. This is likely thanks to the simplicity and the embrace of 'emergent' gameplay.
I get why, but its a shame its not *really* emergent. Every interaction is intentional, everything else is ruthlessly culled. Its a fun party game, but because of this its not much beyond that shallow limit.
Worth the price.

Posted: October 5
Bopl Battle is an incredibly fun game for all sorts of people. It has loads of different options available for people with all sorts of different playstyles. You can play with up to 4 people and is a great option for those who like casual party games with friends that also can have a competitive element. It is exciting, fun, and always a good time with it's different customizable abilities, colours and combinations. It is very accessible with it's controller-friendly options and changeable hotkeys. I highly recommend this game for anyone who likes having an incredibly fun time with friends or anyone else online.

Posted: December 8, 2023
Bopl Battle is a couch or online platform battler with 26 abilities that you can use in tandem with one another. It is extremely fun and I totally recommend it to anyone with an interest for those games. Here are some details I think should be explained:
-While it does have couch(local) and online, there is no online matchmaking. To get in someone else's lobby, you must be Steam friends with them. HOWEVER, there is a Bopl Battle Discord server that has tons of eager bopls ready to fight.
-Starting ability count can be changed in settings, from 1-3. This changes the dynamic of the game, but something to keep in mind is that even with starting ability less than 3, you can gain abilities throughout rounds.
-Matches can be from 2-4 players, and there are 4 teams in which anyone can join any team(except for everyone on the same team). Having multiple players on one team can really spice up the ability combos!
-There is no health system; all kills are one shot. I personally think this makes the game much more fast paced and encourages plays that are high risk, high reward.
-Even if you don't want to pay the 10 bucks, try the demo! You will not be disappointed.
This game has a ton of replayability and I think that if you have friends up for it, you should definitely try it out. Thanks for reading, and happy bopling!

Bopl is an awesome game, and it's especially fun playing with friends! The visuals and the design of the game are very high quality and the game itself is very fun. The diverse nature of the abilities make the game much more fun and unexpected as well. I highly recommend this game, especially if you have friends willing to play it.

Posted: December 19, 2023
Bopl Battle is a fun and innovative couch/online game that allows you to battle your friends with unique and wild abilities. The game offers a variety of choices such as a shrink ray, creating black holes, stopping time, and attaching a rocket engine to the stage to send it flying. You can choose a combination that synergizes well to win the round! The game has received **overwhelmingly positive reviews** from players on Steam ¹.

One player on Steam Community described Bopl Battle as "one of the most innovative and creativity-inducing games of this year" ². The game is fun, enraging, hearty, and makes you think outside the box. There are endless amounts of combos and scenarios that you can come across or think of ².

Bopl Battle is available for purchase on Steam for **$9.99** ¹. It requires a 64-bit processor and operating system, and a minimum of 4 GB RAM ¹.

I hope this review helps you make an informed decision about Bopl Battle. Let me know if you have any other questions!

Source: me (w rizz), 12/1/2023

Here's a chocolate chip cookie recipe:
Ingredients:
2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon baking powder
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
1/2 cup granulated sugar
1 cup packed brown sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
2 large eggs
2 cups semisweet chocolate chips
Instructions:
Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats.

In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Set aside.

In a large bowl or using a stand mixer, beat the butter with the granulated sugar and brown sugar on medium speed until light and fluffy, about 2-3 minutes.

Add the vanilla extract and eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.

Gradually add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture, mixing just until combined. Be careful not to overmix.

Fold in the chocolate chips using a spatula or wooden spoon.

Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto the prepared baking sheets, spacing them about 2 inches apart.

Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden but the centers are still soft.

Cool on the baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring the cookies to a wire rack to cool completely.

Overall. Best 10 euro I spent in ages.

Posted: November 18, 2021
I am not even going to lie, some of the most fun I have had so far this year somehow came from Crab Game... This game is just a whole lot of fun - especially with friends and family, that is when the game is at its absolute best. Nothing beats gathering 5-10 friends/family members and just running around hiding, smacking each other, pushing each other off the map, etc. In theory this game is so simple, yet a lot of fun. It runs perfectly - I mean, the game hardly sets the industry standards for graphics or anything but still - and I would not be surprised if you could run this absolute beauty on a toaster.

The best part is that it is a 400mb download (for you guys with "bad" internet connections) and totally FREE! There is no hating on a free game - heck, I would genuinely pay for this game. I have paid for games a whole lot worse than this before. I hope to see frequent updates and more modes in the future. Well done, Dani!

Posted: October 31, 2021
It all started in 8 of October of 1997, when my governament forced me to go to the army, I was desperate, I had 3 kids and a wife at home, I couldn't just leave them like this to go to war, but I couldn't do nothing about it, so I kissed my wife and kids and just left. Five years later, I came back home, just to find out that my wife was sleeping with another man and my 7 year old daughter was addicted to cocaine, I was completely devastated, my life crumbled to pieces while I was gone, what could I do? I couldn't just go back in time and fix everything, so I did my best to try again and decided to completely leave my wife and kids and I moved to Argentina, and I married this beautiful brazilian woman named Raissa, she was everything I wanted in a partner, we had 6 kids and 2 cats, everything was going well until my ex wife died, I was speechless and I felt really bad and with an incredible amount of guilt, so I decided to go back to the USA and go to her funeral, I found out that one of my kids died too, of a cocaine overdose, after this I really didn't know what to do, did I influence the death of my loved ones just because I was a selfish guy? What could I do to revert this situation? So I decided to take my other 2 kids and move them with me to Argentina, I had 8 kids to take care of, it was really hard in the beginning, they weren't used to the presence of each other and the language barrier wasn't helping either, but with time things settled in and we were all an happy family for a while, but then a hurricane came and completely destroyed my house, I had no money and my wife left with my kids, but on my way to the train I saw a guy on the station with a suit case, I wondered what he was doing there, but he approxed me and told me that he wanted to play a game, and if I won, I would win 100$, I accepted it of course, and the game was Ddakji, I lost again and again and this weird man just kept slapping the ♥♥♥♥ out of me, never told anyone but I have a weird fetish and I kinda like being slapped in the face, but eventually I won, he gave me 100$ and a card, I flipped the card and it had a phone number on it, weird but aight, I had no home and no cellphone so I just went to the nearest phone cabin and called the number, they came and picked me up to this weird game, I arrived there, and there was this big "Crab Game" thingy and a bunch of options underneath it, I just picked the one that said "Find Game" and joined a random server, I was immediatly welcomed by a bunch of 9 years old screaming in my ear, so I just pressed the button in front of me and waited, then the first game started, "Red light, Green light", with this weird ass doll in front of me, I was hesitant, but I started running towards the finish line with incredible speed that I never knew I could reach, but has the doll turns around, I stop just at the perfect time, I was the first in the group, I felt amazing, incredible even, but then I feel the breath of someone behind me, I immediatly felt like I was in trouble, I just wanted that stupid doll to turn around again, seconds felt like hours, but it turned around, I just ran and hoped for the best, but then the doll turned around again, I stopped at the right time again and I felt a little bit relieved for being able to make it again, I was so close to the finishing line! My hopes and dreams were at an absolute high, I've never felt like this before in my life, but has I had this brief moment of happiness, I felt the touch of a hand in my back, my brain started to panic, but my body stayed still, I wondered, why would the person behind me ever do this? What did I do to deserve this kind of treatment? but then, I heard a familiar female voice, and she said "Goodbye, Father" and pushed me to the ground, when I heard these words, all of the memories I had with the family I left behind started appearing in my head, all of those amazing moments I had with them before I joined the army popped up, on those last seconds of my life, I finally understood why my daughter hated me, how could I be so selfish to leave my three daughters behind like this? I only thought about myself and completely ignored their feelings, I just wished I had some more seconds to tell her that I'm sorry, but it was too late, the doll's head snapped towards me and shot me right there.

Posted: April 2, 2023
If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

6 tablespoons unsalted butter

1/2 cup white sugar

1/2 cup brown sugar

1/4 cup water

1/4 teaspoon cinnamon

1 pinch salt

5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced

1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).

Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.

Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.

Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.

Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.

Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Posted: April 5, 2022
Old Fashioned Pumpkin Pie

2 large eggs
1 large egg yolk
1/2 cup packed dark brown sugar
1/3 cup white sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 teaspoons cinnamon
1 teaspoon ground ginger
1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
1/4 teaspoon ground cloves
1/8 teaspoon cardamom
1/2 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest
2 cups pumpkin purée from a sugar pumpkin (see Recipe Note) OR 1 (15-ounce can) pumpkin purée (can also use puréed cooked butternut squash)
1 1/2 cups heavy cream or 1 (12-ounce) can evaporated milk
1 homemade pie crust, chilled or frozen (see pâte brisée recipe or our no-fail flaky pie crust recipe), or 2 pre-made pie shells

Preheat the oven:
Preheat your oven to 425°F.
Make the filling:
Beat the eggs in a large bowl. Mix in the brown sugar, white sugar, salt, spices — cinnamon, ground ginger, nutmeg, ground cloves, cardamom, and lemon zest.
Mix in the pumpkin purée. Stir in the cream. Beat together until everything is well mixed.
mixing pumpkin pie ingredients
pumpkin pie ingredients mixed well
adding cream to pumpkin pie puree
pumpkin pie filling ready to add to pie
Fill the pie shell and bake:
Pour the filling into an uncooked chilled or frozen pie shell. Bake at a high temperature of 425°F for 15 minutes.
Then after 15 minutes, lower the temperature to 350°F. Bake for 45 to 55 minutes more. The pie is done when a knife tip inserted in the center comes out wet but relatively clean. The center should be just barely jiggly.
(About half-way through the baking, you may want to put foil around the edges or use a pie protector to keep the crust from getting too browned.)
Note that the pumpkin pie will come out of the oven all puffed up (from the leavening of the eggs), and will deflate as it cools.
pumpkin pie in dish ready for baking
Baked Pumpkin Pie From Scratch
Cool the pie on a rack, then serve:
Cool the pumpkin pie on a wire rack for 2 hours.
Serve with whipped cream.
