Posted: July 12, 2017
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
I'll be honest. I never heard of Gmod tower before I bought this game, nor was I interested in the game itself, but I wanted a new mini-golf game and Steam recommended this game.

So I bit the bullet and bought it, $15 USD sounded fair for a mini golf game, but I got much, much more for my moneys worth.

The easiest way to explain this game is to mention Virtual world games like the Playstation Home game/app (Which this game is more akin to) and Second Life (Which Tower Unite is not trying to be, but it has some similarities with).

The most basic point of the game is to enter a server (There is a good number of official servers running 24/7 and some 3rd party ones) and find something to do in the "Lobby" (Lobby here means the whole server world), this can be as mundane as going to the casino and mindlessly playing gambling games which may or may not reap big income rewards, going to the theater and watch and/or share videos from YouTube with other people that are in the theater, go to mini games that are around the lobby like Trivia, Bowling or Laser Tag, or you can go for one of the more fleshed out games like Mini Golf, Ball Race (A Super Monkey Ball inspired multiplayer game), Virus (My favorite of the bunch, inspired by the Halo Zombies user game) and a couple of others (With 4 more games planned for future updates).

While playing these games, you get in game money called units. With these units you can buy stuff in the Lobby, and these items can vary from things you can equip and use like the Jet-pack or the Confetti gun (A must for new players) to cosmetic items for your character, and also furniture and building materials for your condo.

Now, about the whole condo thing, I've never been much into the whole making a room/home type of games, but this one piqued my interest and I've been loving the amount of customization one can do to one's condo. You can make a nice mini theater to watch videos with friends, or put down instruments and jam (MIDI support so you can connect your MIDI keyboard is planned for the future), or make a museum dedicated to your art or them dank memes if you are into showing that.

All in all, this game offers a lot of things to do, buy and explore for the measly price of $15 USD, and from what I've seen, the devs are working non stop to finish this game properly and make it as fun as possible without modern day issues like microtransactions or subscription fees.

TL;DR Buy it for the mini-golf, stay for the socializing and different activities/games.

Posted: September 3, 2016
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
Having seen some of the negative feedback this game has been getting lately, I felt like i had to make this review.

This game is extremly fun and has a promising future.

This game is very Early Access but yet there's already alot to do:
- Minigolf: A very solid minigolf game consisting of 4maps.
- Ballrace: A ball Racing game that is seriously fun for casuals and speedrunners alike.
- Virus: A Zombie/Infected game mode with 3maps. (First person shooter)
- The Casino: The casino is amazing, you can play 3 type of slots, Video blackjack & poker machines, Double or nothing machines, You can play actual poker with others (casual or High stakes), there's just so much you can do, discover it by yourself.
- Trivia: The Trivia game is a beast of its own and really make you feel like you are part of a game show, it's always fun to play with friends and it make you learn stuff!
You can Requests your own Questions to be posted on the trivia game as its open source.
- Your Condo: You can customize your own condo with all of the currency earned from playing minigames, inside condos alone there is so much to do, you can invite your friends, join others, explore the creativity of others, socialize with people, listen to music, watch youtube with your friends, watch movies, animes & cartoons (supports hmtl5), play musical instruments such as the Drums and Piano, having parties or chilling with friends, it is a very social oriented game!
- : Customize your avatar with hats and accesories. (currently 3 player models, Male, Female and Milk cartons)
- : Piano on its own is a beast to master, using "VirtualPiano Sheets" you can learn to play your favorite piano songs. (I learned to play some zelda & classical songs)



The game looks great in the Unreal Engine 4.
There is no micro transactions in this game, Everything is acquirable with in-game currency earned by playing mini games.
The soundtrack to this game is seriously amazing.

The Devs are extremly active and always answers our forums Questions, Feedback or Suggestions.
They keep updated on their work and daily tasks on their Official Trello (roadmap).
They have a Twitch stream talking about what they are working on and Etc every friday.
Sometimes they even join the game and come play with us while giving us insights of what's upcoming next. Yes they are a small team (8people) but they are doing ALOT of work.

Posted: March 2, 2019
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
Got this today via Humble Bundle, so there seems to be a lot of people in there who, like me, have no idea what they are doing (although, for some of them, this does not stop them from doing it anyway, or trying to.)

People seem reasonably friendly. Not the friendliest community I've ever gone into (believe it or not, Rocket League, unranked, in the early days, was) but no one that's really rude or abusive this far, either. A few super nice people, and a lot that can just be ignored.

Game looks GREAT on my 5.5 year old computer, but, the graphics card in this computer is an NVIDIA GTX 760 with *8 gigabytes* of ram on the GPU. (That's how you make a computer last for a long time--Assassin's Creed Odyssey looks great on it too.) But yeah... most people have newer computers with better innards, so I imagine it'll look great for most people.

The UI on this game could use some serious work! Yes, I realize it's early access, so there's something to work on; it's not a complaint, just a comment. I had to laugh though when I was trying to leave my condo (easier said than done,) and got asked if I wanted to "cancel" my "join" request, and the options were "accept" and "cancel. So am I cancelling my cancellation, or accepting my cancellation, or .... I had to laugh. Just a minor thing, though.

Having a little trouble with getting comfortable getting my xbone controller working better with it, but I think that's PEBKAC more than anything else. So, I exited the game, did a little reading, said "Ahhh," and "Oh, duh," a couple of times, and feel a little better now.

Basically, what you're doing here is playing games with other people--such as minigolf--to earn "units" to buy things to furnish your home with. And of course, socializing with other people. In the end, that is what will make or break Tower Unite, I believe: If the community stays friendly, it will be a good community. The problem is that the larger the community gets, the less friendly it's likely to be. They'll need to pay special attention to adding minigames that are more geared toward adults, older teenagers, and more intelligent kids... Or maybe put the stuff for griefers and such into a completely different area of the game.

Let's see, what else. LOTS of loading screens, and I honestly almost fell asleep waiting for one of them, but again, there's a huge influx today from the Humble Bundle people, so that could be why; lots more traffic than they are accustomed to.

No microtransactions and no subscription fee means that to keep this going, they have to continue to sell new copies of it. I had honestly never heard of this game until it showed up in today's bundle, so that's not good. I hope it will work though; seems like they could add almost anything to this to draw more people in, such as more stuff like the trivia, and probably even a smallish battle royale mode, perhaps, if they dream big enough, a fun little RPG--just to get away from so much arcadey stuff. Then again... is there a pinball machine in there anywhere?

Oh well. I'm nearly ready to give it another shot; see if I can get my controller working without making TOO many people angry. :)

If you're looking for a community type "game," this one is looking good if they can manage to keep it going.

Posted: December 25, 2022
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
Game has been in "Early Access" for about 6 years now. For those unaware this game was meant to be the spiritual successor to GMOD Tower, a very popular game mode from Garry's Mod years ago. They moved away from GMOD and made this game here. When it released it was extraordinarily popular. The game exploded and was vibrant with the community with a massive amount of players every time you'd log in, sometimes every damn Plaza would be full it was so bustling. However i'm sad to say that the curse of Early Access has taken hold, and the game is not even what could be considered a 'shell' of the older times. I've played Tower Unite on and off, i believe that last time i put some meaty hours in was in the Fishing update and the Christmas after said update. The remaining 'playerbase'--if you could call it that, is pretty toxic, and very drama filled. Cliques of people run Plazas and you can easily get falsebanned for very stupid things. The Devs are questionable in their actions and the amount of falsely banned people is astonishing, considering the original troublemakers are always still at large. Alongside a dwindling playerbase, updates are slow, and very cherry picked. Specific game modes will be updated over others, even if they aren't popular. Virus comes to mind often with this, although Tiny Crusaders also sucks up update time. These are reasonable as..."Early Access" alongside all game modes needing new content. But there is also a lot of strange choices. A very infamous choice was how long it took for the Arcade to release, many years passed (maybe around 3?) where it was never added despite constant desire from the community. It eventually DID get added but...only half of it. They completed half of the Arcade and left it like that for a considerable amount of time.

I love the game, i love the minigames and i miss the old Gmod Tower-esque community. It was really promising. The foray into Early Access for almost 7 years now has really taken its toll. Perhaps when the EA ends and the game fully releases, it'll bring back folks and drive out the rampant drama cess-pool that is the current 300-750 players remaining on this game. I have my expectations low, but am still optimistic about the future. Until then, i'm keeping this review negative.

Posted: February 20, 2017
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
Tower Unite, as many know, is the spiritual successor to the popular Gmod Tower. Now, I personally have never played Gmod Tower, so I went into this game without any real prior knowledge about what the previous game was like. The game is still in Early Access, and from what I can tell there's still a LOT of content that the developers are wanting to add to the game. But let's go over what the game has right now...

The biggest a most-fun part of the game is definitely the Mini-Golf. With several unique courses in multiple different settings, the Mini-Golf definitely had the most thought put into it. It's easy to get into and learn the controls, and when I got the hang of it I feel that this is the most fun Mini-Golf I can find on Steam. Even playing alone you can enjoy yourself simply by getting used to the different holes in a particular course and try to beat your best score. People can drop in and out of any game no matter how far along it is if they so wish, and balls can be customized with hats that you can buy for your in-game avatar with the in-game currency.

The big point to the game, I suppose, is to play games to collect in-game currency to purchase furnishings for your condo, where you can invite friends over to to hang out. As far as I can see, there isn't REALLY a lot to do around the condos with other people other than to show off your stuff and watch videos, though. Maybe that'll change in the future.

Other activities include a few other mini-games (such as a shooter game or a Monkey Ball-type game) and some different, smaller activities in the main lobbies such as a casino, some game-show trivia and a bowling alley, with stuff ike bumper cars, an arcade and laser tag being planned for in the future (judging by the so-far under-construction buildings in the lobbies). Once everything gets finished and put out, there will be no shortage of things to do.

Now comes the biggest drawback to the game. The game can lag quite a bit in the lobbies. I run the game on Windows 10, and on a computer that I largely purchased to play games, and the game can still lag for me. I find that the game lags more on high-populated servers, so because of this I don't even bother trying to get onto a server that's more than half full. Hopefully the lag will decrease when the game leaves Early Access, but for now it's a bit of an annoyance on an otherwise very-enjoyable game.

Do I recommend it? Absolutely. I have a lot of fun with the game and I look forward to seeing where it goes in the future. The lag is a bit of a problem at times and something I hope they're able to fix in the future, but otherwise I think this is a solid game with a lot of content, and more to come along the way.

Posted: February 14, 2017
Product received for free

EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
This review is sectioned off into segments for returning GMod Tower players and newbies who couldn't tell a Hatsune Miku from a good admin.

For GMod Tower veterans who aren't sure if they should make the jump
As someone who has played over 100 hours of GMod Tower on and off, I can say that Tower Unite, at least in the last week that I have been playing it, easily surpasses the Source "powered" mod. Despite the change to the Unreal Engine, much of the "feel" of the old Tower is present, from not just aesthetic and sound, but also movement, interaction with the world, and minigames - and also some familiar issues, such as load times and crashes. For better or worse, it's surprising how much of that Source feeling they were able to get out of Unreal. It certainly helps that, to my knowledge, the key players of the GMod Tower team are working on Tower Unite.

If you're looking for a point to jump in, now's a pretty decent time, considering that Tower Unite at this point slightly edges over GMod Tower in terms of content and polish, with much more to come over the next few years. Considering 15 bucks was the minimum VIP donation amount back in the day (and you bet I paid it), and also considering that past players and donators also get some neat bonuses, it's a pretty reasonable deal in my humble opinion.

Tower Unite is a spiritual(?) successor to GMod Tower, a GMod gamemode in which, to put in as simple terms as possible, players are able to chill out with friends, watch videos, deck out their own condo, and play minigames. A really casual comparison amongst my friends is Second Life, but with less clunky building tools, decade old menu design, and lonely S&M-loving geriatrics. I'm sure there's some online-chatroom-avatar garbage that's more in line, but I wasn't dragged into those by my degenerate friends so I can't really compare them. Where was I? Oh yeah, GMod Tower was all about having fun with friends and relaxing.

Then something brilliant happened. The guys behind GMod Tower (who now go by Pixeltail Games) realized that GMod, and extension Source, were buggy, clunky pieces of ♥♥♥♥ who's updates often broke literally everything and, to make matters worse, weren't the best to develop for what they wanted to produce. Seriously, GMod Tower sometimes felt like it was held together by nothing but copper-wire and the hopes and dreams of disgruntled server owners. So what were these bright-eyed idealists to do? Shut GMod Tower down of course,

But not without reason - they saw big potential in making a standalone version of the Tower, one on the more supported, recent Unreal Engine, and that could support massive updates and new content. Enter Tower Unite, a brand-new, copyright-free, paid replacement for the now-dead GMod Tower.

In the past year Tower Unite has very quickly begun to eclipse its predecessor in terms of content and scale, and still promises much more to come in the next few years. Seeing how dedicated Pixeltail is to achieving something they've been working on for nearly 7 years, I wouldn't worry about them abandoning it anytime soon. With a growing community and tons of stuff to do, Tower Unite is the very definition of a go-to-game.

Posted: June 25, 2017
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
If you don't feel like reading all of my thoughts on GMT, TU, and PixelTail Games (PTG), then just know that this game isn't worth buying, and you should just play something like VRChat.

Let's start with GMT, Lobby 1.

GMT had a great design of an always active social gamemode that relied on a healthy community. To earn GMC, you had to interact with people to get games going, which you could then use to buy furniture for your suite, which allowed others to interact with you in your own little apartment.

Lobby 1, was perfect. Completely, 100% perfect. It might not have been the prettiest, but it perfectly complimented the formula by having you in an enclosed (besides lakeside and the pool) tower that didn't have much room to stray away from people. As soon as you stepped into the lobby and turned left, everything you wanted would be just a simple walk straight ahead, or turn right or left. And no matter which way you looked, you were bound to see at least one person. It being small might not be something that everyone liked, but it made it so even with the server at half capacity (64 players in OG GMT) you would see people everywhere no matter what was going on. It also had seasonal lobbies just to get everyone hyped up for when the christmas and halloween seasons were arriving.

Then, Lobby 2 was announced, and people were excited. A fresh, big new lobby that was so pretty!

But the problem is, Lobby 2 was when GMod Tower was starting to die. A new lobby wasn't needed at all. Yeah, it is gorgeous for a GMod map, and it is really big, but both those things combined only caused problems for both the gameplay design, and the developers themselves. It caused it to still, to this day, never get finished. You might say, "PTG said it was because Lobby 2 was at Source Engine's limits. Nothing else could be added into it."

Edit: Source Engine limits for GMod were only raised recently, but I still know that more things could have been added to GMT Lobby 1. Maybe nothing as much as GMT: Deluxe, but GMT not being able to handle anything more was greatly exaggerated. And even if Lobby 2 was at it's limits then, more could be done for gamemodes. It was only the Lobby that was ♥♥♥♥♥♥.

That's not true as of late at least, GMT: Deluxe, a fan rehost which got shut down after 3 days via DMCA by Mac, was Lobby 2 but finished, with even more things added to GMT. The simple answer is that the PTG devs couldn't keep developing without getting any money, which is understandable. But then they said they'd also just shut down GMT. They could have passed down the torch to someone else, or just left it running with no developers like they're doing for GMT: Reunion right now. (Except that's worse than anything we've had before.) But they didn't.

And as I've said before, Lobby 2 in itself was directly messing with the formula that GMT was surviving on. It being big and having plenty of open empty areas with nothing to do there just messed with things even more.

Then TU came out. And there is nothing left of the design that made GMT great anymore.

Everything can be accessed by menu's without interacting with anyone. Literally every single thing in this game, besides laser tag and minigames in the lobby, can be done without interacting with anyone. While this is a great feature for a normal videogame, this is a horrible feature for a game that tries to market itself as a social game, with an already dying community.

Don't even get me started either on how easy it is to get everything you want in this game. Because you don't need to interact with anyone to get money, you can pretty much grind Ball Race for 20 hours to get a million units, buy everything you want, and then not play again. Everything is horribly cheap compared to how easily you can get money, and it doesn't help that half the server population of lobbies will be in the casino at all times, not talking to anyone and just racking up units.

Now, before you read this next part, remember that I'm not saying this just because I got DMCA'ed by Mac. Rehosting GMT was just a part of my life that i'm not in anymore. I backed this game back in 2016, with hope and love for PTG, and i've changed my mind since then.

PTG, killed GMT. PTG, doomed TU to fail. PTG, has made every single possible bad decision they could make. I don't know what's going on in their heads, what they're doing in the dev voice rooms, but I know that GMT is dead, and TU will never be good, or as good as GMT once was, and is doomed to fail. I've seen people call this a successor to GMT, but this is nothing of what made GMT great.

I have more I could say, but I don't feel like it's relevant to the game, so i'm not going to put it here. In conclusion, and to shorten this entire essay of a review, this game sucks ass.

Posted: May 6, 2020
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
Tower Unite is a social sandbox with a plethora of minigames and character customisation, and is a spiritual successor to a former Garry's Mod server that at its time was both extremely popular and also incredibly laggy. It is a role model that games such as Second Life, VR Chat, Rec Room and PS4 Home aspire to be, but often fail to do so.

When you buy Tower Unite, you are not just buying a single game. You are instead buying more games than you can count on both hands, all included as a single package, and with no DLC. Be warned that this one of those games where once you get in to it, it can become both extremely addictive and possible to sink absolutely 10s or 100s of hours in to it.

Gameplay is divided in to four major areas:-

• The Plaza

The Plaza functions very much like a virtual beach resort, which is the central hub for meeting and greeting, and also possesses a multitude of areas and activities such as fairground rides, beach fronts, treasure hunts, a broadwalk with sideshows, an almost fully-featured coin-op arcade, 10-pin bowling, laser tag, a casino (always better to have a virtual gambling addiction, much opposed to having a real life one), a video-sharing movie theatre, a waterpark, fishing areas, a series of shops where one may customise their experience, secret areas, temporary NPCs that give away free items, and a small arena that frequently hosts time-limited multiplayer activities where you compete against others for high scores. More features slated to be in the works consist of a nightclub, an expanded arcade and fully fleshed out arcade, bumper cars, an on-rails amusement park dark ride, and underwater exploration.

• Condos

Each player has access to a personal residence (condo) that they can customise to their hearts content with a wide array of furnishings, electrical appliances (such as TVs that can playback YouTube videos), gadgets, games, picture frames that can display images from the internet, milestone trophies, in-game collectibles, and user-generated workshop content. Players may visit condos belonging to others (however, be very wary of potentially long load times and/or adult content). You may also choose to allow others to visit your condo. Other players may only visit your condo while you are active within it and only if you grant them the access.

• Minigames

Players may host or join a variety of minigames such as Virus, Minigolf, Ball Race, and Accelerate to name but a few.

Ball Race is a Super Monkey Ball clone where you zorb race against both the clock and others players through a series of progressively difficult obstacle courses where you must carefully manage your balance and momentum while collecting melons and avoiding precariously placed obstacles and bottomless pits.

Minigolf haves you simultaneously tee-off against other players in putting a golf ball through a full 18-hole miniature golf course, where you must putt the ball in to each hole in the fewest possible number of strokes. Each hole progresses in difficulty and features a wide variety of silly obstacles where you must very carefully plan and time your putt as the physics are solid.

Virus is a last man standing type of minigame that attempts to replicate the game mode of the same name that featured heavily in the 2000s British time-travelling, sci-fi comedy cult classic couch co-op FPS franchise TimeSplitters (the spiritual successor to GoldenEye 64), where survivors armed with an array of anachronistic weapons must face off and last as long as possible against patient zero and other infectees. Each round starts with one player being randomly chosen as patient zero who must then attempt to infect other players by using their cunning and catching survivors off guard. The round ends when all players are infected or when the time runs out.

As of June 2020, Accelerate is an arcade kart-racer in the vein of Mario Kart, and is the latest edition to Tower Unite's repertoire of non-plaza minigames. Race against others around cartoonish environments. Drift around bends at speed. Collect and deploy power-ups themed around other minigames in the TUverse to either protect your position in the race or hinder others. However, with Accelerate currently in alpha phase, bugs are to be expected.

• Customisation

Players can customise their character and condo with a wide array of items but not without cost. The majority of items require in-game currency earned from participating in mini games, gambling in the casino, among other activities such as completing achievements and reaching progression milestones. Some items are unlocked only through mini game progression, hanging out in the plaza, hanging out in condos, or through significant grinding in the arcade. There are no requirements to spend actual physical real currency for micro transactions, and custom player models from the workshop are cost free.

Posted: April 9, 2016
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
First of all, calm down, it's Early Access.
Don't expect it to be exactly like Gmod tower because it's not. Not only because they can't use copyrighted assets, but because they're adding cool new content.
So the developers are still the same, they didn't sellout or anything like that.
It's the same Towers, but not on Gmod. This is how a good game does it by itself, but they need time, money and support.

The good stuff!
+ All old minigames are back (Virus, Ballrace and Minigolf, so far).
+ New minigames out and coming soon.
+ New items, new currency.
+ Very nice graphics. (though read the not-so-good section as well)
+ Developers are always there to answer any question.

The not-so-good stuff...
- If you have a low-mid end PC, you won't be able to run it very well, specially when you're in a server with many people.
- Virus doesn't feel the same (it feels much more fast paced, but maybe that's just me).
- Character customization is very limited. I hope this changes in the future, because all people have the same body types atm.
- Servers. This is what I don't like at all. 2 reasons:
1. People won't be joining your condo because it's going to be another server, and that's just a waste of time.
2. Too many servers that aren't official, even though they're dedicated. (so you'll see random people's dedicated servers filling up the list).
- If you play a minigame in any server, if the host leaves, the minigame is over.
- It doesn't feel like a community anymore, people just straight join into a minigame, or their condo. I don't know if there's any reason to join the plaza anymore. I miss the waiting queue for the minigames, but maybe this is more practical (I really wish everything would be in the same server though).
- Some annoying bugs to fix, but you know, it's Early access.

If this game never grew and stayed the same as it is now, I'd actually rate this bad, but since the developers are so hard-working and dedicated, I have no problem giving this a good review, because I know it will get better.
I was in the Private Alpha and content came out frequently and this doesn't seem to change. So give it a try, even if you don't play it now, you'll play it later for sure.

UPDATE:
Due to the hard work from the develpers adding new content from time to time, I'd recommend it to anyone, because it's getting really fun. I only wish there was more people around. Come play! :)

Posted: August 28, 2021
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
After reading many of the other reviews for TU, I found that, from the context of a new player looking to purchase the game, they probably weren't too helpful. I'll offer some insight into the game, largely based on my personal experiences and what I've learned at large. The goal of this review is to be a small primer that tells someone interested in the game what to expect and what not to expect.

What to Expect

TU is a very casual-friendly game, easy to pick up, with plenty to do and things to keep you occupied. This is the type of game I fire up when I just want to wind down after a long day, socialize with some friends and not have to worry about too much. This is not a hardcore game. You play at your pace and set your own goals, whether that be having the most amazing condo set-up ever, or earning all of the badges from the various minigames in the game. Being a social game, your experience will, in large part, be determined by your interactions with other players. One recommendation I have to anyone new starting the game is to have a friend of yours also start with you, and to start playing with that person. It's very difficult to get into this game if you have no one to play with at the start, and I can imagine this has been the reason certain people don't get very much into it. While it's possible to go it alone and meet people that way I think you'll have much more luck with taking a buddy with you from the beginning. Another thing I have to mention is the community. I've met some really cool people here that enjoy this game. However, there are a lot of bad apples in the form of trolls, furries and people just generally looking to ruin your experience (often these people will check all three of these boxes). These people can be avoided easily enough, and you can continue on your merry way to find sort of people that will enjoy hanging out.












Keep in mind that everything I've described has been through my personal experience playing the game. Yours will be your own different, personal journey. Between the condos, minigames, social aspects, and continued development, TU has a lot going for it. To anyone new or who is on the fence about purchasing this game: you can help create the type of experience you want on the game. When it comes to social interaction within the game, avoid the type of players you need to avoid and gravitate towards the ones you get on with. Do the same thing with minigames, playing what you like, while avoiding the games or activities you don't enjoy. Maybe you're not interested in the condo/decorating aspect? You can ignore it entirely if you so choose, and can simply enjoy the minigames. I hope this review was in some way helpful to you. If you decide to get the game, I hope you enjoy it as much as possible! Final note: Me and a friend on TU often throw parties at his condo in the game. New players or other cool people are always welcome to join in the fun. We'd be happy to help you get to know the game if you have any questions.

Posted: February 13, 2021
Product received for free

EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
TL;DR: The game is good, but the devs may mark you as a cheater if you're too good. That and you/your friends may get bored quickly.

I really wanted to recommend this game, I can't do that because there are fundamental issues with the game and some interesting choices made by developers.

I will say though that the game is good. There are a lot of fun things to do in this game. So if I were you I would look at gameplay of the available game worlds and maybe look at some of the workshop condos available to get an idea of what you can do before you decide whether or not to get this game.

Over the year I've played I have recommended the game many times and have even bought my friends copies of the game. However all of these people no longer play the game. The game has an issue with keeping an audience. With the plaza, the condos, and the game worlds it takes very little time to "see it all" and be done. That's why when there are major updates there will be a huge increase in players and then it drops off again.
There's nothing to really keep people playing. Yes there are cosmetic items you can unlock, and the games are fun, but there's no real sense of progression other than getting better at the game itself.
You earn units to upgrade your condo and buy cosmetics for your character, but there is something missing in this game to keep people coming back. Whether it's the lack of people being social in the game, or some game worlds being so empty that you can't find/start a game, or even if you're not into building a condo, I think the reason differs person to person.

My major reason for now not recommending the game is because the recent action taken against the Ball Race leaderboards.
As you can see by my hours I have played this game a lot, and many of those hours were playing Ball Race.
For those people who don't know there was a launch glitch known as 'buffering' that allowed players to get an impossible/unfair time to people who didn't know about the glitch. Recently this glitch was banned (or at least so I've heard) and as a result a lot of top level Ball Race players were banned/marked for suspected cheating. Upon providing video evidence a lot of these players were unbanned. To me I feel like I constantly need to be recording my runs in case I get a time that is really good. That's not how I want to play. I want to play the game without having to feel like I need to look over my shoulder and make sure I have evidence to prove my innocence.


If you really want this game and it seems cool, go for it, but be aware that you may have a hard time keeping your friends interested or maybe even keeping yourself interested. And be wary about the possibility of getting too good or you may be marked a cheater.

Posted: April 7, 2021
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
It all started when watching Jameskii's video "Not VRChat" where he played Tower Unite.

The game instantly caught my attention when he was on the Whirl-a-Fish arcade machine (the Monster Drop arcade machine in Tower Unite).

After the video, I instantly purchased the game and fell in love with it. I even encouraged two of my friends and my boyfriend to get the game aswell, and they also don't regret purchasing it. We always have such a fun time together ^~^
Even a new friendship grew thanks to the game ❤️

I played it over 50 hours in under a week (I had vacation) and I don't think it will just stay by that.


So, in conclusion:

The pros:
- It is extremely fun to play
- For the price it is offered at you seriously get a lot of content (Casino, Arcade, multiple minigames, Bowling and much more)
- The huge variety of custom avatars you can choose from (Workshop avatars :D)
- The amazing customization options for your condos (your residences)
- The extremely amazing ping (I live in Germany, went onto an US West server and still had a ping between 70-80, which is amazing)
- The aspect that there are absolutely no microtransactions
- The constant updates (the developers do not leave the game behind like other developers did to other games)

The cons:
- As perfect as it is, there are still some parts in the game that are a bit buggy or need a better finishing touch (for example the Billards physics)


The game is definitely completely underrated and way more people should get it. It is a lot of fun and with friends it is even better 😊


I definitely give it a 10/10
No changes on that statement.
Would totally recommend it.

I mean would it be cool to see this game hit VR one day? ABSOLUTELY. Do i need it to enjoy the game? Absolutely not. Again, take my advice or dont everyone has their own opinion but at the end of the day this game has some great developers and are constantly making great changes and adding new things or events.

Posted: June 14, 2020
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
Here's a list of what you're buying:
No micro transactions
Minigolf
Ballrace (basically super monkey ball, real fun physics)
Little Crusaders (basically Ultimate Chimera hunt, everyone tries to press the button on the dragon's back while it kills them)
Virus (Infect FPS)
Zombie massacre (top down zombie wave survival shooter)

And plaza minigames which vary in quality:
Bowling
Trivia
Poker (multiplayer and singleplayer variants)
Blackjack (singleplayer)
some kinda boring slot machines that have a net profit and jackpots
Laser tag (usually the more people the more fun, only a single map to play on)
Typing derby (race of who can type the fastest)
Theater (Place to watch stuff with your friends, you can do this in condos too)
Condos (You can customize your own home, all with in game currency you buy from games. You can upload images and workshop models too)
Random minigames in plaza (Can be kinda fun)
Plaza (place to hang out, do a lot of the things i mentioned above, and lots of stores and funny little secrets and easter eggs if you look closely)
Cosmetics, weapons, and toys (Lots of fun stuff to buy. Jetpack that lets you fly. The weapons are only for looks but its fun to hit people with them. Lots of bonus stuff to find around like potions that make you tiny and such)
Any time use any 3D player model from the workshop for your avatar.

This game has a fun unique charm and humor to it. Lot's of jokes hidden around, and on item descriptions.




People complain about not being able to make matches in games that aren't ball race and minigolf, but if you go to the lobby and make some friends, or even just ask chat, you might be surprised how many people want to join you.
For all the bad reviews of this game, I have to say it's still worth the price. The game is still incomplete, but there's lots to do. Most of the bad reviews on here still have many hours, and that's probably because they enjoyed the game. Even if they were disappointed with slow development after they used the game a lot.

Maybe they'll add the new in progress features in the next 10 years, maybe the next two, I don't really know. If you get bored go check it out after an update, or come for the seasonal events.
Point is there's lots to do for the price of 20 dollars, and I think that's worth it and the game is fun.

Posted: March 5
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
Are you tired of the virtual worlds you tried already & want something way better than Meta, Second Life & VR Chat? You are in luck, this game allows you to do way more than all three of those games!
It lets you have more people in a single area (64 people) versus VR Chats (40).
1. There are WAY BETTER moderation controls in this game to help you moderate users compared to Second Life & VR Chat. (*People can't crash you! *You can hide avatars, you can voice & text mute, you can block profiles, you can ban & kick. *You can implement your own rules for your home!)
2. You can actually build far better looking worlds and better games than Meta & VR Chat. You don't even need to open up Unity or Unreal Engine, you can build it all from within the game itself!
You can actually use ANY of the custom models that people upload at any time in your home!
Say you visit your friends house and they built using custom furniture, all you have to do is look up those items in the workshop and you can put it in your house to!
3. You can change your avatar to ANY of the available avatars at ANY TIME for FREE in Tower Unite versus in Second Life & VR Chat where you have to actually go looking for them or buy them with real money!
4. The games & music that Tower Unite has by default are actually GOOD & FUN!
5. Although anyone can play any game, there are a lot of very cool/chill/social people who play this game, in my opinion much more so than the competition.
6. You can actually NAME your house so people know what to expect & can find it easier, for instance you could write that you are hosting an event or want to meet new people etc, unlike VR Chat where the instance is the same for everyone and you don't know what to expect.
7. Last but not least for those who are interested in Virtual Reality, this game HAS VR, but it is still being improved on! So there is no reason to wait!

Posted: March 21, 2022
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
After 400 hours, I think its time I give this game a proper review. If you've ever wanted a game to play in which you can just relax and hangout with friends, this is a perfect game. The amount of stuff you can do is insane, from spending hours watching random Youtube videos in your condo with friends, to gambling in the casino or relaxing at the arcade, there's never a dull moment.

The minigames are also fantastic, we currently have Ball Race (which is basically Monkey Ball), Virus (Zombies Vs. Humans), Accelerate (Mario Kart), Minigolf (which is as good if not better then Golf with Your Friends), Zombie Massacre (basically Dead Ops Arcade in Black Ops 1), Little Crusaders (1 Dragon vs. Knights), and 3 more minigames on the way.

If you like decorating or building, you can spend hundreds of hours (guilty) customizing your condo to your liking, or you can buy a completely flat map and build your own condo from scratch. Almost every piece of furniture can be customized, so you aren't limited with what you can make. There is also Steam Workshop support, so you can find items you like and place them in your condo.

If you ever get bored of hanging out in your condo you can partake in many different plaza events, such as Treasure Hunting, Snowball fight, Chainsaw Deathmatch, Fruit Frenzy, etc. You can also spend some time at the pier catching fish, or meet up with some friends to play Laser Tag or Bowling.

The only downside is that this game can get laggy sometimes, especially when hosting a huge condo party. If I have more then 10 people in my condo at one time, I will drop from like 50fps to sometimes 10fps. This game really needs to be optimized more, but despite that, It's an incredible game and I've made some extremely good friends on here. I recommend giving this game a shot, especially if you're into games like VRChat.

Posted: January 1, 2017
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
Tower Unite... where to begin?

This game is just a huge improvement over GMOD Tower. GMOD Tower had some paid features like dimming the lights and such and had been limited by the engine which was the source engine. GMOD Tower had a lot of fun things to do in it and it did it well which is something that I think the developers of GMOD Tower did very well which was push the Source Engine to it's limit to provide one of the best GMOD experiences that I have ever seen.

Tower Unite just expands on it and makes it 100 times better. The Unreal Engine 4 allows for much more than using Source Engine. Instead of having to wait for the painfully slow GMOD Tower loading screen, this game allows it to be quicker and easier to use which I appreciate them doing. It also allows for more personal creativity of your character which is great and in the end, makes this a huge improvement over GMOD Tower.

Pros:
-Better Engine than GMOD Tower
-Character Customization
-Condo Customization
-Mini Games which You Can Play With Your Friends and Still Earn Money
-Currency System
-New People To Meet
-Watch Videos with Friends in One Room

Cons:
-Sometimes Weird and Glitchy Cosmetic Items
-Placement of Items Can Get Glitchy in the Condo
-Sometimes Odd and Weird Community

This game is still in early access so things are bound to change. Right now, bugs and glitches are the major cons and I am hoping to see them ironed out and fixed as soon as possible but in the end, this is a great game and I would recommend anyone looking to buy it to buy it now because your purchase supports the developer and the developers need as much money as they can to make the game possible and entertaining to play!

8/10 as of now. Will Review Again When It Officially Releases.

Posted: August 28, 2020
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
Tower Unite is a large online world filled with games and activities to keep you busy for many hours.
The game in fact has so much to offer that I don't even know where to start.

Create your own character or use one of the many available on the Steam Workshop.
Buy a condo and style it to your own liking, invite your friends to watch a movie in your house or in the public cinema.
You can even buy music instruments and give a private concert.

When you enter the plaza you start in a mall, here you can buy furniture, toys, electronics, wearables or other condo's, just to name a few.
But for me the fun started after walking outside, where you see different buildings like the bowling center, arcade, casino, cinema and the fun fair.
The Arcade is filled with all sorts of games, beat your own high-score or that of others and get on the scoreboard, collect tickets and exchange them for all sorts of prizes.
Rather want to play something with friends or randoms? Enter the GAMES building to find mini-games such as midget-golf, racing games, laser gaming and even killing zombie's.

Maybe you want some relaxing time and go fishing!
There are many types of fish and items of different rarities to find in the sea, and you can even keep the fish and put them in your own aquarium at your condo, or sell them to make some money.

As you can see, the list of things to do is endless, and the game is still in early access!
I can't wait to see what else the developers have in store for us in the future.

Posted: October 21, 2017
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
This game is such a letdown.

On paper Tower Unite sounds incredibly fun; playing games with your friends, earning currency to purchase cosmetics and furniture, decorating your condo, etc. Essentially the social aspect of the game is what makes it fun for me. Constantly playing Mini-Golf or Virus (because these are the only populated games usually) does get boring after a while.

Sadly, this isn't enough to keep the game alive. The 12 developers, supposed "full time" (Monday-Friday, 10 AM - 6 PM) work at a soulcrushingly slow rate. The updates they do release are usually barren of content or outright useless (rollercoaster).
They also appear to have their priorities wrong; one example is working on parental controls (which again, is being worked on incredibly slowly) that no one really needs right now. Another example is furniture, but guess what; it's only rocks, trees and plants. Not tables or anything like it. I feel like they have too many projects going on at once which may explain the slow rate of content being produced.

What the game needs is content, even new cosmetics or furniture added regularly would help keep the game alive by giving players something to work towards. Right now I don't see this game moving forward because of the disorganized and inefficient development cycle.

If you visit the SteamCharts page for Tower Unite, you can see that the player population is dwindling despite having around 130k owners (as of October 2017), again indicating a lack of interest in the game due to the lack of content. Player retention is going down the gutter because of this, and it's a real shame.

To the developers, I ask you to spend some time considering what the players want or get rid of the dead weight because there is no way 12 "full time" developers can work at such an abysmal rhythm.

Posted: March 3, 2017
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
I played Gmod Tower for almost two years. I was so impressed with what the developers of this game were able to do with the Source Engine and create Gmod Tower. I put in a little over 200 hours into Gmod Tower, and was excited to see that they were planning to make a stand alone version of Gmod Tower, with little to no engine restrictions for what they wanted to create.

When the Kickstarter failed, they instead made a Indigogo with a more reasonable price goal, and they exceded it by $20k. I'm happy to be one of the supporters for the game financially. I am very, VERY happy with how the game is coming along. The graphics are great, with the most recent update (2.0.0) they've reduced the very long loading times to something more reasonable, the currently implemented games are very fun to play, and even more to come in the future.

Not only are there games, but you can use the money you collect from games and activitys to furnish and customize your own condo, you can sit down and watch youtube videos with others. Overall, this is a very casual expirence, and it's amazing. They plan to do so much with this game, and what they have delivered already makes me feel my $200 investment was well worth it. I cannot recommend this game enough, and encourage people to buy it, even in it's early stages. The game is still amazing to play.

Posted: August 20
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
Generally good for its price.

Parental supervision required for minors.

Positives

Condos

In my opinion this is the strongest feature of the game, making your own personal space and expressing your creativity.
Creation tools work for the most part and new features being are added such as Condo IO and more steam workshop integrations.
You can find great creations made by players .


A significant part of this game will be sharing YT videos and music through the media players scattered all-around, works well-enough and is a good experience.


Both inside and outside the plaza you can play a great quantity of minigames, they can be a lot of fun.


The developers are still actively making additions to the game , generally meet the roadmap and do provide status updates regularly.





The game suffers from having a very small playerbase which negatively impacts almost every aspect of this game, you will have a hard time filling lobbies for the games and contributes to a generally feeling of emptiness all around. This is greatly exacerbated if you are not a player from the Americas as that is the largest player group time zone.
The developers don't seem to be making much effort to address this issue, keep in mind if you expect it to improve.


Though the game does have a lot of features you will find that not a small amount of them lack polish, you will come across bugs that can harm your experience interacting with them, unfinished parts and some lack of cohesion.
Netcode is not great so playing gamemodes (especially PvP/Adversarial ones) is not that great.

Media Players suffer for not being able to play MP4 encoded videos on YT. (Not all but some videos are affected)


There have been added components to the game that don't seem to really add to the experience relative to the work required to implement and makes developement of the game seem to lack focus.
The greatest example of this is the addition of Libretro, it doesn't appear to have been asked, it servers no real purpose apart of being a gimmick, and is for the most part forgotten and unused.
UGC features are being added very slowly with odd updates in-betwen.

If you plan to stay long-term keep that in mind.



As with any multiplayer game you have to gamble on the kind of players you will come across, overall for Tower Unite is quite positive, you wont find extremely toxic people , and there are veterans that are very friendly and have set-up tons of unofficial events and small communities. Very LGBTQ+ friendly.


When entering player condos keep in mind that there are no restrictions for what can be put on canvas items, if you are streaming disable all canvases. It is very common to find unsafe content.


For 20 bucks you will get more than your money's worth if the game interests you as advertised, you can get an odd 50 hours from minigames and about 200 including socializing and creative building aspects.

Posted: August 21, 2022
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
After playing this game for almost 1000 hours as of writing this review and doing almost everything the game has to offer, I feel like I have a decent understanding of the ins and outs of this game and how the mechanics work. It's been an amazing experience that I would love to share with everyone!

Introduction: I always seem to get back to this game, even after I have a break to play other games. I love being able to socialise, do mini games with my friends and play casually. If you don't have friends to play this game with, the community is very friendly and welcoming compared to the majority of multiplayer games that have a lack of moderation with the report system not doing anything to combat the issue, resulting in toxicity and being disrespectful while hearing all kinds of terrible slurs. From what I seen, this game takes all reports serious and will take action if there's someone that might be trying to mistreat you and make you uncomfortable. This is what other games should try and do to make it a welcoming environment for everyone to keep the player base healthy. Tower Unite is very underrated and definitely deserves more attention!

Anyways, here are the pros and cons of the game from my own experiences and perspective.

Pros:

- There is a lot of things to do at the Plaza with many areas to interact with. There is something for everyone to enjoy. It may be overwhelming for new players, but there's a lot of people that would be more than happy to help you with the basics and get you into the game!

- The amount of items you can obtain in this game is crazy. Even after investing so many hours into the game, I still have items I have not obtained yet. It's perfect for those that love to achievement hunt and complete everything. There are so many collectables and rewards to get. It is also impossible to 100% this game and get all of the achievements since the game is still in early access with achievements that you can not obtain until they get implemented. However, you can complete the majority of the achievements, having over 90% of them being doable. You also get money for completing achievements, so there's no reason not to hunt for achievements if you want something to do and achieve!

- The mini games and events are fun and perfect for earning money and playing with your friends. Some mini games give you more money than others, but it's really worth trying all of the mini games and seeing what you enjoy the most. Mini Golf is probably my most favourite one to do and is the most popular one among the community. It's definitely worth trying!

- If you love decorating and customising, condos are amazing to play around with. You can spend hours to try and make the perfect condo for everyone to enjoy. There's a wide variety of condos to choose from with many ways to adjust your rooms to your liking. It's very relaxing, and you can even let your friends access most of your tools to provide some assistance with your condo and make it more enjoyable and easier to customise.

There are a couple of cons that I found when playing this game, but I'm very sure that the majority of these issues will be fixed in future patches!

Cons:

- The optimisation can be bad. I found the FPS to be very inconsistent, even if you have a really good PC with high end hardware. For example: You can be at 144 fps for one moment and then it dips below 100 fps out of nowhere, regardless of what you do. I found the Arcade is the worst area when it comes to this, having constant FPS drops. This can be a little irritating, but this shouldn't affect your enjoyment if you adjust the in-game settings to make it more consistent.

- Bugs! Some places and mini games are buggy, but they are usually minor. In the worst case scenarios, it is a bit of an inconvenience. As the game gets updated, it should be much better.

Overall: This game is highly recommended with many, many hours of content and ways to entertain yourself. I found a lot of lovely people in this game that I ended up becoming friends with. This game has the friendliest community I've ever seen, making it a very enjoyable experience. There can be some horrible people every now and then, but action is taken if you report them due to its amazing moderation. I really look forward to see what else this game will have in the future as more major updates happen. It may be slow, but it will definitely be worth it. Thank you so much for making this underrated gem, PixelTail Games <3

Posted: August 15, 2017
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
Very Awesome Game.

Let me start off by saying, don't let the player count put you off. There may be a peak of 400 players per day, however that is plenty for you to have fun and play games with. 99% Of the community is welcoming and Nice to new players and will play minigames with you if you ask in the chat.

- The Plaza:

The plaza is awesome. It may be a little unoptimized at the moment, but it is bearable. In the plaza you have access to everything you need: Minigames, Stores and more. The plaza gives you access to areas such as: The Casino (Where most of the server is quite a lot of the time lol), Lasertag (Fun Team Based FPS minigame), Bowling (You know what that is, c'mon!), Trivia (Great fun, questions get thrown at you and a bunch of other players - awesome!), Typing Rally (Where you have to type as fast as you can to get to the end with your horse) and much much more.

- The Minigames (Virus, Little Crusaders, etc...)

The Minigames are amazing! Each minigame feels like its own unique game. Virus is an FPS game in which you start off as a survivor, 1 person out of all of the survivors is infected and has to infect all remaining survivors. The survivors have to survive for around 2 minutes. It is a really fun mode (One of the best in my opinion). Little Crusaders is a game in which you either play as a Knight or a dragon. 1 player plays as a Dragon, the others as Knights. The Knights have to Push a button on the Dragon's back while the Dragon has to eat all Knights. Simple, but really, really fun and addicting.

There are quite a few other minigames (Ball Race, Minigolf and another which is in a rough state right now (It is being fixed though)) and these are great too, I just don't have hours to write this review.

By playing these Minigames you earn Units, which you can use to Purchase:

- Buyable items

Using units you can buy many things. Units can be earned by playing Minigames, or by gambling at the Casino. With Units you can buy Clothes, Character Effects, Equipable items (Such as confetti guns), Furniture and electronics for your Condo (Your own House/ Apartment basically). There are many things to buy after playing a few mini-games.

- Your Condo

You Can Own A Condo (A Small Apartment or Large House of sorts). These Condo's can vary in size and what they look like, but they are ALL customizable. Most recently they have added an Underwater condo, it looks cool but is pretty expensive (400,000 Units!). You can design many things in your condo, you can decide what the walls, floor and ceiling looks like aswell as many other things. As I said earlier, you can also buy and place furniture. In Your Condo you can watch Youtube with your friends (If you own a TV), mess around and pretty much just have fun.

- Do You Need Friends To Play?

No. The simple answer is No. Friends may make it more enjoyable, but they are not needed. By playing Tower Unite you will 100% make friends. After my First 10 Hours Playing the game, I already had 3 new friends, we play together quite a lot. If you play on your own you will still have fun. The game is great with, or without friends.

- To Wrap Up

Tower Unite is an amazing game and is 100% worth your time, and your money. Even at full price this Early Access game is amazing and will provide you with Hours of Fun even at its current state. More stuff is also being added Constantly, so the fun will never really run out. Get bored? Wait a few months and have tons of new stuff to do!

- Warning

Do not, whatever you do go into the Casino. You will never escape, you will never ever get out. Legend even tells of one lonely soul who was stuck in that hellhole for decades. Beware.

Buy the game. Its Great.

A game that I wish I had installed and played a long time ago. Though, more then satisfied with the time spent as of this moment and will be looking forward to plenty of hours in the future.

Early Access Game - One that is fulfilling watching it grow.

So buy it, play it, own it..
Simple.

Posted: April 15, 2019
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
I really, really, really love this game. It came into my life at a time when I was having a hard time and it's really done wonders for my psyche. I've made some good friends and I always have fun.

It's kind've a mixed bag of a game. If you remember PS Home back in the day, it's very much like that except no microtransactions whatso ever. All game currency is earned by playing games and unlocking achievements. But if you don't remember PS Home... well... Think of it like a giant hub. Steam Workshop integration means you can pick from a wide range of avatars or design one yourself! You have a lobby where you can hang out and there are minigames, a casino, a theater, stuff to buy and things to do. There's a main game port for larger scale games like Ball Race which... is the 7th layer of hell. XD But I digress. You also start the game with a condo so you can buy stuff and decorate it if you want or even buy a different condo. There's always something to do and something going on and it's still in Early Access so it gets updated regularly. It also means there are still some bugs and things break from time to time, but it doesn't detract from how awesome this game is. I love it very much and I hope if you end up purchasing and playing it, We can be pals! ^_^

Remember GMOD Tower? It's got its own game now.

So yup, just wait a little bit and the game will be the best than ever.

It's difficult for me to describe what kind of game Tower Unite is like. I've even interacted with him on one occasion in-game, it was awesome. I have a 1000x more respect towards devs who will interact with their community regardless of how bad it can get sometimes. So I personally thank you guys for doing all that you do.

And yeah, the game still does have it's quirks, and maybe sometimes it might just freak out on some days if you stare at it for too long. That's just how it is when it comes to playing anything in Early Access. Despite that though, there's still so much to see and do. There's always something new to discover if you look hard enough.

tl;dr: If you have an itch to play a game that you can always come back to with your friends or generally just wanting to find a "chill out and talk" type game which you can totally spend hundreds of hours doing, then this is the game for you.

review:
Posted: November 29, 2020
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
When this game first released, I honestly thought it was going to be dead on arrival. Even though GMod Tower had a vibrant, rich, and full-housed history, I honestly thought the hardcore GMod Tower crowd (which included myself) wouldn't be impressed by a new game on a new engine that seemingly promised to carry the massive legacy of it's previous incarnation. Well, I was proven wrong. The launch of the new game was awesome, even though features at the time were bleak and the game had a good amount of obvious bugs, however, most of us at release quickly realized the full extent to which this game could end up becoming. So, I decided to stick around, and the developers ended up fixing many if not all the obvious bugs, but also kept adding more and more content. Me and my friends who were previously always on GMod Tower gave the new one a shot as a group, and we played for hours. The old crowd is back around, and the new crowd is welcoming and just as fun as the glory days back then. I'm happy to say that even though Tower Unite shouldn't be considered a replacement or continuation of GMod Tower due to it's obvious changes, it is most definitely a haven where old players and new players alike can feel the same "warm fuzzies" and have a blast exactly how we did in the previous title. The truth is that GMod Tower will forever be lost - those classic Source engine bugs, the 300+ ping everyone had, the overcrowded lobby covered in puke, and the condos that looked like Counter-Strike Source bled into a different reality. However, Tower Unite is only the next chapter in the lives of those who played that original GMod Tower, very similar to how college is for folks who just graduated high-school.

I give this game a 100/100, alongside a personal thank you to the devs who keep the show alive. Godspeed.

Posted: April 10, 2022
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
This game has a lot of content that you can do, from casino slots to arcade machines and games, minigames, mini golf, mario kart style racing game, ball race, infection gamemode, fishing, lazer tag, bowling, movie theater and more! There are a lot of items to collect to, if you are a collectionist you will like this game. Also, soooo many achievements, for so many different activities, completing these are really a dopamine rush.

There are 2 currencies in the game, Units are the main currency of the game and can be earned from various activities. Second are Tickets which can be earned from the arcade to be used in Arcade specific shop which includes variety of items.

At certain months of the year, there are events happening with new and old event items appearing with event exclusive minigames, plaza events etc. You can collect event coins to purchase these new items, there can be accessories, toys, pets, condo items and more.

There is also a condo system which you can purchase one or more houses and decorate them however you like. You can invite friends or other people to your condo too. The game has a youtube player in it for TVs, laptops and phones so you can play videos or music in condos too.

So the game is packed with content, there are more things that I didn't list or probably missed and there will be more things to come since it is still in active development.

I would really recommend this game, it is really fun!

EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
Tower Unite is a virtual game world focused on being involved with the community. The game features various activities to do such as socialising with other players, playing minigolf, decorating your own condo and more. It's also important to note Tower Unite includes NO microtransactions either, all the currency you earn is earned through playing games or doing activities.

Posted: September 27, 2020
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
I've spent some more time on this game since my review, it's time to change and add onto my original opinions. Tower Unite is pretty much a social MMORPG at it's core, a really good one. If this is something you've been looking for, look no further.

I had a rough start with this game trying to get my grounds and learning how things worked. Some social anxiety preventing me from going out of my comfort zone and interacting with people/asking questions. A game like this strives from social interaction, and thankfully a community like this if you're standing around doing something by yourself it's likely someone with more knowledge will come reach out to you and show you around. This will lead to some new friends that are easy to be made. Before you know it, if you have social anxiety you'll slowly become more comfortable with meeting new people.

The game offers a lot to do. On it's surface, it looks kind of barebones once you've tried out most of the random games you see around. Though you'll realize how many small details there are in the game with different milestones and actually a pretty decent grind in unlocking some things you may want. The best part about all the things to do is it's unlikely you won't find someone else tagging along which makes the experience much more social and enjoyable. If you like grindy games this game can definitely be your cup of tea, it will take a very long time to max everything if that's what you desire. Though this is also completely optional and unnecessary, it really depends what you're seeking from the game.

The game can be played very casually without much of a grind, you can do what sounds like the most fun at the time, and meet new friends on the way. Once you got some friends together you can take it to the next level and join eachothers Condo, which is an extremely in depth player owned house with endless possibilities.

The game shares some similarities to VR Chat (without the VR and force to use voice chat), Garry's Mod (supposedly Tower Unite was originally based in Garry's Mod), and even similarities to Second Life and grindy RPG games. If you like any of those games I think you will enjoy this game. Many very enjoyable minigames, tons of stuff to do and ways to hang out, tons of cosmetics and customization on your player model and your player owned house (Condo).

I highly recommend this game. I've already had so much fun and met so many amazing people. I look forward to see what the game has in store in the future. It's been in Early Access a long time yet it still receives updates regularly. The game is not dead.

Posted: April 27, 2016
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
Successor to the great Gmod Tower, Tower Unite is a stand alone version with an almost an endless stream of new possibilities to offer. Tower Unite IS in early access as I currently write this which leads many to say it is "not worth buying right now." I argue that weather you buy it now or during later updates it is most definitely a must have if you're big into socializing and just having a nice place to unwind after a long day of work or play. Despite it being under construction the dev team works around the clock to bring quality content and beautiful visuals. The plans they have for the game down the road are amazing and I'm beyond excited to see them unfold.

Both the game play and social aspects are very diverse and very fun. Sometimes I think of Tower as an amusement park, or a playground. They provide us with the tools, and it's up to us the players to enjoy ourselves and encourage one another. The core of Towers players are amazing, passionate, diverse, friendly, and wonderful people. It's hard to play this game and not make a few new friends along the way.

I have the utmost faith in Tower Unites developers to bring quality content in the future. They're amazing hard working people who listen to community feedback and understand that respect and understanding are powerful tools to make a great community.

TL ; DR : Early access or not, Tower Unite gets a 10/10
The game is fantastic and I know for a fact it will only get better as time go's on.

Posted: 20 June, 2017
GOTTA GO FAST!

When I first heard of Clustertruck it seemed like a silly game that would only entertain me for 5 minutes at best.
Boy was I wrong, not only is Clustertruck an extremely fun adrenaline rush with great replayability, but it also got me hooked to the point that I played through all the levels in one sitting. All there is to this game is jumping from truck to truck while dodging obstacles, which can sound quite boring, but the real fun starts when you treat it as a parkour speedrunning game by trying to complete everything as fast as you can. Went through all the levels? Buy some upgrades and do it again. Upgrades sometimes drastically change the way you play by adding interesting mechanics. Completed it again? Get some friends together and challenge eachother, see who can beat a level the fastest.

For being such a simple game, Clustertruck is a surprisingly fun and replayable parkour speedrunning game. I highly recommend anyone who is on the fence to give it a try.

Posted: July 2, 2019
Clustertruck.
Just my kind of clusterf*ck!

The Bumpersticker
Clustertruck is a high-octane, frenetic, responsive, and chaotically enjoyable first-person platformer. The game, oversimplified, is about running and jumping across levels filled with obstacles, on which only large semi-trucks are safe to come in contact with. Its single-minded tactile fun, and it’s unapologetic about it, much in the vein of games like DOOM (2016) or SUPERHOT. Clustertruck takes speed, skill, polished level design – and big explosions – and wraps them all together into one hell of a ride.

The Trailer
Clustertruck’s campaign is short and sweet, yet packed full of quality. Each progressing level introduces nuances that keeps the game difficult, but never infuriating. In this sense, every stage is a puzzle, and it’s the player’s objective to solve it in the fastest, most wicked way possible. As you jump from truck to truck you build momentum, which, when combo’d correctly, can send you hurtling at ridiculous speeds past several obstacles. This speed, however, will only make it harder to land on the next truck with precision. There are abilities to earn with style-points as well, such as the power to slow down time, or use a grapple hook to catch yourself from a level-restarting fall. This spattering of mechanics allows you to be creative in your approach, and are what fundamentally drives the gameplay.


Though not the most fun or inventive game made, Clustertruck certainly holds its own as a one-of-a-kind gameplay experience. There are other elements I could have mentioned, such as the graphics, the soundtrack, or even the competitive element of the game. But none of those are the reason you should play Clustertruck. The reason to play Clustertruck is that it’s good old-fashioned video game badassery, and that’s getting pretty rare these days.

Posted: October 2, 2016
Just beat "Clustertruck". What an absolutely phenomenal game. I have been following it's development since alpha when it was called "Super Highway Fight Squad" (glad they changed the name, isn't as catchy lol). For a game that is relatively simplistic in design, run on trucks don't touch the floor, it is INCREDIBLY polished. The soundtrack is full of great peppy synth and rock ballads, the graphics are smooth and pleasant, the controls are tight, and there are a ton of levels. 80 in fact. Oh, and there is an extremely robust level creator which I am very excited to see the user created content for in the Steam workshop. If you are looking for a fun, challenging, and bonkers game look no further than

CLUSTERTRUCK

EDIT: Oh, and use abilities as little as possible. The game is much more fun and challenging without them.

Posted: September 29, 2016
No real trucks were harmed in playing this game.

But srsly though, I recommend this game because:
- The game is easy at first, but once you get further, it gets challenging, yet still fun to beat.
- Amazing level design and graphics.
- The music is the best. (Especially the laser world, which I personally like.)
- Different abilities to modify your truck-jumping experience.
- Workshop support. Create your own custom maps.

A game this good also has some cons:
- Somewhat short of a game. Needs more levels.
- Some few overlooked bugs present.

I played the alpha version of this game before and I commend the devs for this fantastic game. I rate this game 9/10. Buy it, you'll like it!
