Posted: April 23, 2021
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
Well, I'm over level 2300 and 2000+ hours in, guess I should edit this review to reflect that...

SAR is one of my all-time most-played games at this stage, up there with Diablo II, WOW, Warcraft 3 and Rome Total War. I have quit a couple of times but keep coming back. Why? Mostly it's because I made so many nice friends in this game and miss them whenever I stay away. But it's also just good fun, exciting, cute and enough of a challenge to keep you engaged.

I've played a lot of online games in my time and this still one has one of the nicest little communities you could hope to find. There are many kind, funny, friendly people. It's a game where shy players can feel comfortable, unlike other online arena games which are often toxic cesspits full of rude children. It is rare to come across a truly toxic player in SAR, and the mods will take your reports seriously.

The animation and sound design are both incredibly charming, which helps to create a pleasant atmosphere.

Some of my favourite games as a kid were top-down shoot 'em ups, so I have a place in my heart for this kind of game. I'm a fan of retro graphics and in many ways prefer this simple style to modern 'realistic'-looking games. Both graphically and in gameplay, SAR brings back the simple fun and heart that early computer games overflowed with, whilst still having the QOL features and polish you'd expect from a 21st century online shooter.

The gameplay cycle is easy to learn, but as a newbie you should be prepared to die a lot - there are lots of us who have spent a long time gitting gud at SAR and with no system for level-based matching, you will find yourself with a challenge at peak hours.

Fortunately, if you get a good group of mates together, dying can be almost as funny and fun as winning. Just try to have fun and don't take it too seriously! The cute graphics really help. My advice is to maybe test the game out in the rotating modes (SVR and Bwoking) to get a feel for gunplay and movement; watch how more experienced players move, learn what spots and weapons work well, etc etc. If you are polite and friendly, you'll find players who are happy to help you improve.

Is it perfect? No, it has its problems, but no game is perfect. The weapon balance is pretty good at this stage. I would like to see more focus on the BR aspect, as the devs have switched a lot of resources to the time limited modes for a while... but on the other hand, I'd also like to see pure DM and/or TDM modes added for when you just want some brainless action.

It is perfectly possible to enjoy this game without paying a single penny, but I bought the founder's pack and super edition at full price to support the devs as I think they've made a wonderful little gem here. I've bought every season starter pack and will continue to support this game as long as they keep putting their love into it.

Posted: October 13, 2019
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
great game, loved hotline miami and this lets me show off my hotline skills. for early access, very little bugs.

10/10 but hopefully non-furries eventually play this game

EDIT: So, after 300 hours, I got one major issue with this game and i wrote all this text cause of it.

TL;DR: separating the game into "super free edition" and a purchased version alienates f2p users, confuses prospective players, and ultimately slows the growth of the userbase. i know thats a mouthful but ima go through it lol.

-being f2p sucks. you can't queue up with friends through steam, only through discord. this means that even if just ONE of your friends doesnt have the full version, ya gotta all leave your steam lobby and create a new discord lobby and invite your friend that way... which is buggy. half the time the person can't see the invite on discord, you gotta switch the lobby host around and it's really just a pain (I just started buying people the game cause its ridiculous).

-so far, ive gotten about 15 people to try out this game, and roughly half of them have gotten confused when I told them it was free. And if you look at the store page, first thing they see is that it costs $12.99. then, they see that theres only a demo of the game. after that, when they open the demo to try out the game, they see “BUY THE FULL VERSION!” all over. not a great first impression.

I asked a SAR mod about this, and they said the purpose of separating versions like that is that F2P games get less exposure on steam… but is steam’s purpose to market your game? I think that’s where the community, youtube, and streaming come in… which brings me to my next point.

recently, ive been playing many games where there are only about 8 people in the game. 8 real people, and 56 bots. even on peak hours, just 25-30 people. I think its important to note, usually most of the people wearing cosmetics. Barely any F2P’s… the newbies that might actually BUY the game.

as of now, I think the community isn’t growing as fast as it should be… even if the game is only a year old, and even considering it’s still in early access. In the past, decent-sized youtubers and streamers (and even deadmau5!)... have brought new traffic, but we’re still out here playin in smaller lobbies than the week before.

I think this is where I restate my thesis. Frankly, I think seperating the two editions is stunting the growth of this game. Yes, I think F2P should get steam lobby invites, the base level gray cosmetics, and more animal customizations, cause unlike 3d battle royales, you gotta look at your guy a LOT. Yes, I think pixile is using a business model from 10 years ago. Yes, I really like this game and I just want it to do well.
Anyway, there’s my 3-point essay. Just had to get that off my chest. Forgot the hook tho. Its whatever.

Still 10/10.

Posted: January 28, 2021
Super Animal Royale is a third-person shooter battle royale, where you play as a furry animal fighting to be the last animal standing in a battle royale arena. You can play alone or with a team of up to four. The game is divided up into 3 game modes: Solos, Duos, and Squads, based on the number of players in your party. A fourth game mode, SAW vs. Rebels, is a 32 vs 32 mode that is occasionally available as well.

The gameplay is pretty fun. There are a variety of weapons to find and choose from in the world, so there are options to suit your play style. The Epic and Legendary weapons are hard to find in the world, so you won't find them every game, but all of the weapons in the lowest 3 tiers are pretty abundant, so it shouldn't be too hard to explore and find what you need. It definitely takes some practice to get to know the map and get better at surviving, but winning is definitely possible, especially in the modes where you have teammates to back you up.

The backstory to the game is fun and is subtly incorporated into the map. There are fun little Easter eggs you can find, some of which come with bonus skins you can wear in game. The gameplay itself really doesn't have any story-related elements to it, even SAW vs. Rebels, but the backstory you can get from exploring the map is a fun bonus on top of the gameplay.

The biggest weakness of the game is the small playerbase. Almost every game you get will have some bots in the match. At peak times there might only be 10-20 bots needed to fill a 60 player lobby, but in off hours there might only be 10-20 human players in the lobby. Games with bots aren't that bad, as the bots usually end up killing each other or getting killed by players early on and the end of the game has a bunch of human players facing off. However, the games with more humans are much more unpredictable and fun, so more players will help the game improve.

The game has gone completely free-to-play in an effort to expand the player base, and in that regard it has been somewhat successful, as the player numbers have gone up from what they were when there was a paid version. Now the game is monetized through sales of cosmetics. There are some cosmetics you can obtain for free by playing the game and some that you have to pay for using SAW tickets, a paid in-game currency. I personally have no problem with these kinds of microtransactions, as they don't affect gameplay and you can earn some of the cosmetics through playing. There are also DLC packs which have exclusive animals breeds, emotes, cosmetics, and SAW tickets, or you can just buy the SAW tickets on their own.

Overall, Super Animal Royale is a really fun battle royale shooter that's great to play on your own or with your friends. The game is pretty great now, and I can't wait to see it improve as the player base expands and it's able to support more game modes. 9/10

Posted: May 16, 2022
Super Animal Royale is one of those games that will make you keep playing it after 500+ hours the gameplay is simple yet it can takes so many hours to master it. But let's start form beginning.

So SAR is an Battle Royale with 64 players in one map, it has unique camera placement. Most BR games are first person shooter or third person SAR on the other hand is top down shooter. The game is focused primarily on fast and quick combat, weapons in this game hit like a truck what makes dueling very stressful. Every single match (without dying first) last around 5 to 6 mins max, also the games end so quick that you can hop into one or two matches during your break time. Then we have guns that can literally kill you in a blink of an eye right nothing special but what's more? Well besides dying fast, the gameplay is also focused on the movement, yes your human like animal can turn into a sport car with a simple press of an spacebar, after clicking it your character performs a roll making you move faster for a short period of time and if you press it again in the right moment you gonna move even faster. Keep in mind timing this is kinda tricky.

Next thing that I wanna touch are the graphics. Putting simply the game is adorable and done in cartoony style, most of the unlockable animals are well done and after some time you're gonna have your favs and ones that you probably gonna hate (I'm looking at you hippo) and being honest there is nothing more to add. The graphics are simple but the style is what hook me up in the first place thanks to this game. Oh and did I mention that you can customize your character with items you get after leveling up? Yeah just like in TF2 you have vanity items you can equip on your characters, meaning if you are like me you will end up with 16 pages of loadouts.

Next aspect is community. I played a lot of online games in my past, mostly the popular ones and oh damn I gotta say some of them are known for their community. So when I witnessed how many wholesome people are out there I just could not believe what I saw. The community is small, but is very supportive, friendly and really seeing someone trash talk is an rarity.

The only issue for me is that after playing for some time the game gets stale. Yeah it is one of those easy to learn, hard to master type of games but there isn't that much content. Overall there's not that many different weapons. Updates drop for like every 2 to 3 months adding at most one new location to the map and new battle pass is added and after finishing it there isn't that much stuff to do out there so yeah for some people it might be a big drawback.

But overall the game is worth trying out. Even if some of you might find it not very promising by it's name or by how it looks. The gameplay is addicting and satisfying, the community is something that you don't see much in other titles, what more can I say is that if you've never played it maybe you could give it a shot and see how it works for you?

Posted: November 18, 2020
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
Overview of the game in it's current state:
I absolutely loved this game, and I still do, the gameplay is extremely fun, and the artstyle is adorable. However, the most recent update brought along a lot of changes that I personally would say were for the worst. I shall write two reviews, a review of how the game was, and my opinion on it, and a review on how the game is now, and my opinion on it.

My review of the previous versions:
This game is the perfect battle royale to me. It includes all of the best concepts of a battle royale, such as:
60 people free for all, playable in solo, duos, and squads.
Fast, fun, and varied gameplay.
Hundreds of fun and interesting cosmetics.
Addicting.
Great to play with friends.

However, unlike every other battle royale out there, it's missing all of the annoying parts of the typical battle royale, making it so much easier to focus on the best parts. It removes annoying things such as:
Cosmetics which are so expensive you have to pay for them.
A battlepass that you need to grind every day for multiple hours in order to unlock everything.
A toxic or overly competitive community.
Hackers.
A requirement to be generally quite good at aiming and have fast reaction times.
A system that makes it incredibly hard to get any of the cosmetics.

The game does an amazing job at removing all of these problems, simply by not including the most common features that hold back battle royales and makes them feel all the same, such as the ones listed above.
Instead for it's cosmetics it chooses to reward players with random cosmetics every 3-6 games, making the game feel very rewarding to play. Instead of grinding out to get currency, just so you can buy a skin you wanted on the store before it leaves until who knows when, you have no choice in the matter, and simply are given random items, some you want, some you don't. But no matter what you get, you have an extra fun thing to play around with when customising your character.

For it's games it even includes bots to fill out the remaining players, which makes it very common to fight these bots, which for a new player can be super fun and thrilling, while also being an easy enough fight for you to get used to the controls as you practice fighting them. But there can still be enough of them to take a skilled player down too.

Because of these two things, mixed with the fact that the game is a one time purchase, with no money-hungry decisions to be seen the game, it allows the game to feel extremely relaxed and fun, allowing even the most casual of players to fully enjoy and become addicted in this game.

Overall, it is the best battle royale, because of it's courage to stand out from the croud with no micro-transactions to be seen, and a fun, quick, addicting but also casual gameplay experience.



What positive changes were made:
I personally believe that the new UI is very nice, if not a bit cluttered. However, overall the new UI looks more professional over the previous one, so that is a plus.
It also added a lot of colour weapon skins that can be unlocked from killing a certain amount of players with those weapons, which is a very fun and encouraging update.
Unfortunately that's all I can praise from all of the changes, as even the new game mode that was added is very confusing and cluttered, and personally it isn't fun for a casual player.

What this update/version of the game ruined/did wrong:
To put in in as little words as possible, all of the previous praise I had for the game is gone. It now has micro-transactions, which feel extremely overpriced, especially considering previously the game only cost £10 to have everything in the game for you to unlock with no extra cost. It also has a battlepass, which is paid for with the premium currency, is very long and grindy to unlock items, and you don't even earn enough currency from completing it to get your money back.

Furthermore, this new paid battlepass removes the casual-friendly aspect of this game, making everyone who plays hungry for exp to not waste their battlepass, so you're a lot more likely to encounter full lobbies with players that will stop at nothing, and probably have 1000's of hours in the game more than you.

The random cosmetic drops which made the game feel so fun and rewarding has now also been placed with a shop of randomly shifting daily cosmetics, as to be expected from a battle royale game, and instead of getting a random cosmetic every 3-6 games, you get a small amount of coins per game, and it'll most likely take up to 15 games now just to be ale to buy one of the most cheap cosmetics on sale in the shop, that you probably don't even want.

Overall I feel that the game is now a lot worse, and I will continue playing once the squads gamemode has been added back in to see if that feels as fun as it once was, but overall the tone of the game is worse, the value for money is immensely worse, the reward for playing is worse, and it just feels like the game is forcing you to become addicted, rather than allowing you to play it at your own pace.



If I had to suggest a way to fix this, I would propose that the shop should be replaced with a catalogue of every item in the game, and simply allow players to save up for anything that they want, instead of tempting them by the randomness of the shop with an item they may never see again. As well as this, more of the currency should be rewarded, and if the battlepass is going to be paid, then it should at least give the player back the amount the spent on it, if they complete it. While quite hopeful and unrealistic, I would also want to see a "Premium DLC" or something, costing maybe £50 or so, just to have the battlepass not be paid for, maybe double exp drops, and maybe infinite premium currency, or at least a large amount.

I feel it is not worth complaining too much about the new changes and instead just offering suggestions as to how the new changes could be improved to keep the game how the developers want it, while also making it still enjoyable for fans of the previous versions. Currently I am very unhappy with the game in its current state and I will probably not play it nearly as much. I hope this review didn't come across as too negative or whiny, I simply want to give my opinion on the game and its new update from the opinion of a casual player, who loved the previous versions, but not the new game.

Idk how to end this thing so, bye I guess lol.

Posted: August 27, 2022
I never write reviews for games, ever. But because I have 1300+ hours in this game, I feel like I can make a review that people should definitely consider.

This game is an absolute blast to play casually.

There's a reason why I come back to this game and just play it out of spite. It has a fantastic concepts, with great execution. I think the way to truly enjoy this game is to play with friends because you will die, a lot. And dying isn't fun in any game anyways so losing together and winning together is definitely the way to go. That being said, I'll move over to why I wouldn't recommend playing this game more than you think you should.

I have played this game for around 3 years at this point, since late May of 2019. I've watched this game transform in many ways. Both for the better and for the worse. I won't get in depth with everything, but I will mention the biggest issues that are still applicable as of writing this review.


I think the number one reason for this is because of the game's lag. In most of other games, lag is a disadvantage because of the fact you respond slower to enemy actions. But in Super Animal Royale, lag can actually be an advantage. I won't go completely in depth with how the net code and lag system works, but in the simplest words: if you hit the enemy on your screen, it counts. This is a huge issue (and I have over 40 video clips to back me up here) due to the fact that if you're trying really hard to learn the best skills and mechanics in getting good at this game (bullet dodging, efficient movement, leading aim, best load-outs, etc), then it becomes almost useless if you're facing against someone who's lagging. They will end up hitting you on their screen with their bullets, when on your screen, their bullets are missing and whiffing pass you. This becomes extremely annoying after it starts to happen consistently against you, and ends up making you lose matches because of it. Also to mention, people can lag so hard that they end up having jagged movement, causing you to miss a lot of your own shots.

I've also been the one to care for the numbers and statistics of weapon damage, METAs, and overall competitiveness of the game. And when I take a look at the current state of weapon balance, it's not good. There's always different types of playstyles in order to have better chances in winning against certain weapons, but most of time, it doesn't matter against automatic weapons, AK being the worst to play against. Now I'm not here to keep elaborating on every single reason why each and every weapon can be fixed, but I will say a couple. Shotguns and JAG-7s need to have lower bullet range (like seriously who thought a shotgun can be a long range weapon AND completely destroy level 3 armor, actually unbelievable). Sniper rifles need a revamp in recoil where slowing down and scoping in has significantly better accuracy than just straight pulling the weapon out of your pocket while super rolling all over the place and firing a straight lazer to your opponent. BCG has a tracer now, why does the bow not have a tracer? They're both charge up weapons, what makes the BCG have it and the bow doesn't? The crossbow kind of needs a buff if its going to be considered an epic/legendary weapon since the main issue being it can't take down people fast enough especially with its clip size being so small, even the Bow would be a better choice because of the fact it can infinitely shoot. Both the Bow and Crossbow almost serve the same purpose in the game, just the Bow being a straight upgrade. AKs, SMGs, M16s, Tommys, all auto weapons need some sort of nerf. I'm not saying to lower down their damage or fire rate directly. That's not what they need. They need some sort of counter play to those who click and hold their mouse down while spraying and praying to win the game. Because it legit is that easy to win the game as long as you have an AK. I can suggest adding a throwable item that slows down the rate of fire of the opponent's weapon to counter automatic weapons. All other weapons are completely fine as is. However, I do wish that there weren't just new weapons that are just upgrades of other weapons. For example, the Deagle is just a better Magnum. Why add a new weapon if it's just the same weapon but better? Same applies with the AK and M16. It makes no sense to me to add a new weapon that is quite literally the same exact thing. Also another thing to mention is to balance the movement speeds of each weapon, biggest issue being JAG-7 users who run at 100mph with only needing 2 shots to kill people.

I would also like to mention another issue with this game, that being the micro transactions.
There are a couple of things you can purchase with real money in game, all of which are cosmetics that do not provide a pay-to-win advantage. The premium currency in this game are SAW Tickets, which like other games, can buy you premium cosmetics that are unattainable through playing the game alone, or used to buy the Animal Pass (battle pass). Now let's take a closer look at the pricing.
You can basically just say that for $1, you can get 100 tickets. I am currently looking at the shop for what you can buy and, theres a fork in the game you can hold as a melee weapon for 500 tickets. An entire $5 for one single item you can hold, and you're probably like not going to even hold it for a while because you need to hold guns instead to kill. Lets go ahead and compare it with something like the cost of Undertale, which is $10. There are also other things you can buy such as a single mini pet in the game for 750 tickets. We can also compare it to another aspect of the game, that being the Animal Pass. The current Animal Pass is only 550, and if you end up completing it, you get 29 different cosmetics, a bunch of Carl Coins (which can be used to buy even more cosmetics), a mini pet, and get 350 Tickets back. So for basically 200 Tickets, you can get all of that. Now that is what the game's micro transactions should be. Just like how I have played Rocket League in the past, cars were only a dollar each (they aren't anymore but that's besides the point). And even then, I was able to trade up a few of my Rocket Pass items away to obtain the next pass and continue my pass.
In essence, SAR's battle passes are good, but buying single cosmetic items are way too costly.


It's completely valid to try and improve on winning in this game, but just remember that you will have those lost games you should have won.

Hopefully this helps!

Alright, I don't think I made it clear enough, my bad. I'm not trying to say that this is a bad game. It is a fabulous game for casual players like 99% of the community. It's fun to play with friends, and just a great game to play if you're running out of ideas. This game is extremely addictive, and in all ways, a well rounded one. I'm only not recommending this game to those who wish to see the game in a different light, the light I wanted to shed it on aka the competitive side of it. I know that there's also a player base who want to genuinely get good at games, and for those of you who want to get good at it, this isn't for you for the reasons I have stated above. Thus why I don't recommend it because I am a competitive player myself.

Posted: September 24, 2023
Don't get me wrong.. I LOVE this game, I am lvl 1000+, play it constantly and have 1500 hours in it. This game in-and-of-itself? Super fun, addictive, and just overall great and I love it.

However.. The community sucks and there are a lot of minor things making this game hard to play. The few things that are the games fault itself:

-art contest(s) are rigged and pretty much a top 7 not a top 21 (the same people win over and over, and I have a hard time believing with 500+ entries that that was a mistake). I feel like it's just a way to not pay the artists they want to win, but who knows. I think they should avoid having the same people win cuz it gives people (ESPCIALLY KIDS) false hope of winning the contest, and trying their best just for flavorrr and Pome to win for the 6th time in a row.

-Im not sure about damage or gun balance but, from my personal experience, it's pretty badly balanced if surviving on a pixel of HP is common in your game, you can survive by a pixel in other games, however it's shocking and fun/funny when you do. In SAR it just feels like you got scammed or scammed someone else.

-The hamster balls are laggy af, and half the time I die to them, on my screen they were no where near me (this is also on my closest server).

-They have pride stuff in game, but if you say "im gay" or anything similar. You get a warning and possibly muted for 24hours. That.. is disgusting. When I complained about it they told me "i was engaging in adult conversation" which just sounds like the homophobic argument of "don't tell the kids the "gay" word. Just overall disappointing and gross.

-There are NO IN GAME PENALTIES for dipping on your teammates, or DCing right as a match starts. This is even in other non-competitive games like DBD and such. I have literally seen people DC over and over for HOURS in squads. Just to make it where you are a person down.

-Last big one. When your teammate DCs mid match they aren't replaced by a bot, or anything. They just sit there. Idle. Until they die. Meaning that you, if you are dead, just have to sit and wait. You can't DC because if you do you get none of your "rewards" for the match (drops, DNA, XP, ect). That is.. the dumbest thing ever lol.

I love and am passionate about this game, but GOD does it need a clean up.

This isn't even mentioning the lack of balancing, the sweat try hards that ruin playing this game for fun, and.. many other things.

What I do like about this game:

-The gun play is AMAZING. It is SUPER addictive and fun, the guns feel nice to shoot, and that's a key thing in.. yaknow.. a SHOOTING game.

-The devs seem VERY invested in their community and the game they have created. Every update as of late really shows the talent of the team and how hard they work on this game, I cannot say enough this game is amazingly made.

-the gamemode saw vs rebellion was legit the best addition to SAR for me, its my favorite game mode. It's so fun.

-The overall style/aesthetic, SAR is so unique and interesting. I love the world, the art style, really almost everything. Its fun, silly and well put together

Would I recommend this game?

Yes and no. I really think they things that need to be fixed NEED fixing, and to not be rewarded. However, I don't see that happening. So if the things listed aren't a make or break for ya, go for it. The game is fun, and I am sure most people would like SAR.

Posted: May 15, 2020
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
A battle royale game for people who don't usually like battle royale games.

PROS

- When my friends recommended I try this game I was genuinely not turned on by the idea, but after trying it I fell in love with it. It is not competitive, and it is easy to learn and get good at and also easy to play for someone like me who isn't good at games like this.

- The free version lets you play the whole game pretty much, minus all cosmetics, and buying the whole game gives you EVERYTHING pretty much, so you don't feel like it is shoving microtransactions down your throat 24/7 like other games love to do.

- The art style is just adorable and very polished. The map is BURSTING with personality in every corner, and you can tell a lot of love was put into this game. The music, though there is very little of it, is also boppin. All of the sound effects are very satisfying and everything wraps it up in an adorable little package of wholesomeness... if you ignore the fact you're murdering each other.

- The community is one of the kindest I have come across in an online game, which is a rare thing. People are welcoming, ready to answer questions, and most are really good sports. I love that this game is not competitive, because it lets you have more fun and really embrace what I think the game really is about... just being adorable animals and doing cute dances as you murder each other. As someone who struggles with my competitive nature, I never once felt angry from losing in this game. In fact, there were times when losing has been more fun than winning.

- the variety of animals and cosmetics is stunning for an early access game! I feel like I still have so much to work towards and I have already unlocked nearly every milestone, and leveled enough to reveal every animal. I enjoy when a game doesn't get stale too fast by running out of things to unlock or work towards achieving, and this game has done well in making unlocking each the animals a grind. I can appreciate that, as it feels like I have really earned them when I finally get to them.

CONS

- If you like competitive hardcore battle royales, this may not be the game for you. This game is definitely for casual players, and you wont find as many challenges. There are very good players in the community, but even they don't seem like they're competing for a leaderboard title.

- Replay value highly depends on what you enjoy on a game. I find it easy to keep playing over and over, but other people I know get bored quick of the same formula over and over again. The game can struggle to stay fresh unless you're working towards something like a new animal, or trying to get a certain cosmetic, or trying to level up.

- There aren't many people playing this game currently. I am not sure how many players will be on when the game finally comes out in full release, but as of now, the most players I have seen in a game has been less than 30 out of the 64 cap. That means matches are full of bots most of the time, and you frequently reach the top 10 whether you're a well practiced player or not. Sometimes it sucks playing with just bots in hours of the day when player traffic is low.

- There is a lot in this game already, but it feels like there should be more! And that is no fault of the game, as it is still early access! I am not including this point as a complaint necessarily, simply as a notice. If you feel as though it is lacking, remember that there is likely A LOT more to come!

Posted: March 28, 2022
Well well well... Here we are, where to start?

this is one of the easiest games to pick up and play, with a kid-friendly aesthetic, a bopping soundtrack, and a mostly friendly community. It ditches all the technical fidelity, to make something just fun to play. And with past updates the game is accessible to anyone with a gaming platform, whether that be PC, PlayStation, Xbox, or Nintendo Switch, anyone can play. it goes back to the roots of traditional battle royales, without extra technical mechanics in it, there's no proning (bc it's a top-down side-scroller perspective), no buying back, no bounties, no hero operators, no special perks, no load-outs, no attachments, no teleporting, it's just simple.

but all good things do come with flaws, or "happy accidents" some say the skill gap is quite large, with pro players that know every trick in the book compared to your little brother playing this game. As I've stated before, the game is easy to pick up, but it's hard to master. Some others say the weapons god awful, and I can partially agree (looking at you BCG) but in all seriousness, this is a more focused weapon sandbox, with no overlapping weapons what so ever... ok so maybe the Epic and Legendary overlap over base weapons, but still, each weapon can have a unique role within the sandbox, I won't spoil anything, that's for you to figure out.

The simplistic art style is one to cherish, as every animal is mostly unique and ofc ADORABLE. with every 10 levels, you get more animals, and there are so many to choose from, 369 in fact, and that number is continuing to increase over time. with seasonal updates and new modes and events to keep bringing players back. and with each base animal, you get tons of different and wacky variants of each animal.

The modes, oh boy... well you have your standard Battle Royale modes like solo, duo, and squads, but the event modes throw a monkey wrench into the mix, with a Battlefield type conquest mode with 32 v 32 action, a "Mystery Mode" which is standard squads but with a twist, and the most recent addition to the modes roster "The Bwoking Dead" it is essentially a horde based PvP mode where survivors try to fend off against a zombie infestation and extract. And the Zombie Chickens, well they will stop at nothing to try and infect all the other survivors. And this is only what we have now, who knows what the future might hold...

In the end, Super Animal Royale is def worth the time, it's free, it's a mostly friendly community, and it's just a blast to play... And no... you're not a furry for playing this.

Posted: May 16, 2019
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
I bought this game during the Easter sale and man, did I not anticipate to have this much fun in a game. Battle royales have always have had the same issues for me- long unrewarding matches (if you lose), toxic communities, and micro transactions to the max. None of these are present here. Matches are short- you don't feel super invested and devastated if you lose. The longer you're alive gives you more DNA for the next animal you want to become. Its addicting in that "I can get one more game in before I need to sleep" kind of way. I love it as my fiance can get into the game as she gets motion sick in any game that utilizes a camera. There is skill to be gained in this game- I feel I get better after every night of playing this. My only complaint would be the item drop rates. They released lightsabers- 85 hours in, still no lightsaber. They have a trade up system for items, but it doesn't help when you barely get items playing this game. In hindsight, the low drop rates means that diehards will still get rewards as they play (that I'll eventually become, if I'm not there yet already) Get the founders pack as a donation to the devs- they work hard at bringing constant updates to the game.

Posted: June 1, 2021
Super Animal Royale, Overview and Experience.


I'm not gonna procrastinate on this review any longer.

Super Animal Royale or SAR as I'll call it, is a 2D, MMO, Battle royale Shooter-based game that's more focused on the community rather than a whole lot of content to it. At first glance, SAR may just seem like a children's game, but as the Developers themself admits, this game is aimed toward a more mature and older audience because behind its cute artstyle, it's a deep learning curve to its competitivety which I'll dive into in a moment.

Just to break down one part at a time, SAR has been some of the most amazing and memorable moments of my life, yet some of the most heartbreaking ones as well, I've seen people absolutely disgrace SAR, quit it, and a lot of drama around it, but I've also got to meet some of the most amazing people I've ever met through SAR, people I today have daily contact with.

As I mentioned, SAR completely relies on the community which means everyone you meet, and everyone you get in touch with will all create your experience and journey throughout SAR, and this comes from someone who has played 70% solo games. Without any company, SAR itself is pretty repetitive, same map (yet they do update some locations from time to time), but mainly with the same concept; become the last survivor. Not too much variation to it, but that's pretty typical for a Battle royale game.

Picture this, if everyone used a default skin, with no communication or interaction with others, no one would play SAR. That's the beauty about it, it's the complete opposite. Just cosmetics alone, you get a large library of customizations to personalize your character and identity, with every new set of cosmetics being requested by the community. And a very active centerpiece for SAR is the Chat and communication where you get to meet, talk, and even interact with others. This game is one of the few that has a rule to be "Pawsetive" which really brings up the welcoming, supporting, and loving atmosphere!

To highlight a negative aspect about this, the company you make, makes the whole experience, this means that all drama, all broken relationships, and every wrong path with the wrong guy linked to SAR will harshly affect your motivation to even wanna play it at all. But I prioritize forgiveness and moving on, however, this doesn't apply to everyone, which means you may very well stumble up on what you may consider a friend at first but later on backstab you when you least expect it. And that's the risk in laying all faith in the community.


Now, SAR is the best thing I know when it comes to fooling around with friends and just having a great time but when it comes to actual performance, there's a bit of contrast. Outside of SAR we have an unofficial leaderboard website where pretty much everything you do get's tracked on a top 100 players leaderboard in literally everything you can do in SAR, this makes a lot of players grind day and night just to reach the top of a specific or as many as possible leaderboards.

Here's where the competition strikes in, there are some known players that only play to top each other on those inhuman leaderboard numbers. I can tell by experience since I've at one part of my SAR career been grinding stats, it only makes it toxic and at one point I was really close to quitting SAR for good, till I realized how pointless leaderboards actually are, but it doesn't change the fact that some people don't view it that way, tryhards or sweats as we like to call them like to get together to create a literally unbeatable squad where they grind their 100% win streak for hours, which is what makes it so ridiculous for players who just want a casual game but have no chance of winning.

SAR is a game you have to put hundreds if not thousands of hours into to reach the top of your development state, because every gun and playstyle is unique and you can absolutely clear out your opponents if you just know how to place your cards right, you other predict someone's exact movement or doesn't at all, every gun and its playstyle is unique and it all comes down to your preference. So, if a sweat appears, unless you got hundreds of hours of experience, you can just get ready to become someone's prayer. Quote from a well experienced player;

Because of the PTSD SAR has created in me, from meeting the wrong people to becoming the sweat who only strived for getting that sweet top 15 position on the leaderboard. It made me write a negative review about this game which stayed for a long time till I realized how much good it actually has provided me, meeting some of my best friends today from SAR, interacting and taking a win or a loss with just as much joy!

Can't thank you enough SAR, it's been a long journey, with rollercoasters of all sorts but it has made me grow as a person. Yet it sometimes may feel a little repetitive, but it's still a fun game to play. For me, it's more then a silly game, it's a bond in between people, an acceptance and loving atmosphere you can't get anywhere else, it's like a bigger family!

I feel like there's still a lot more to cover but better wire it up than diving into every minor detail.

Posted: March 1
I promised myself to review this game once I hit 1000+ hours / sorry for any mistake I might have on this-

Super Animal Royale, as other folks in these reviews say, is a 2D animal battle royale game, with hundreds of animal breeds to unlock and unique cosmetics to help you find out what you like to wear yourself or match with another player. Only unique animals/cosmetics that are locked behind paywall is the ones in the starter packs, super edition, and founder’s edition (which the last one is unobtainable and older starter packs are in the vault)

Gameplay wise, for a new player, can either be a hit or miss depending on what lobby you end up in. As the pro players can easily demolish you and bots can be a little messy depending on what they have (hunting rifle bots *shivers* ) continue on to this, this game is not exactly too friendly with new players as the tutorial is quite lacking. Although, finding and figuring out your game strategy and weapons, you can slowly get better at this game. Which inturn can have an addictive game play once you find the rhythm.

Community on this game? It can be difficult to explain but it's like any battle royale community, there’s some cool folks and rather toxic folks, being an ex-streamer and still pretty active in the CC communities around this game. You’ll figure out sooner or later on what folks to avoid and what folks to continue interactions with. As this game community is pretty open and friendly, yet feeling the need to have better “gems”, Season Pass Emotes (which can cost 7 dollars), and more, because it seems like the community isn't too open to Free to Play players or new players unless you have something unique to you, to continue interaction. Toxic parts of this community can be seen easily, yet these types of players do the toxic interactions outside of the game, and instead use discord,youtube,etc. To either harass or do negative stuff like that.
Toxic in game? Mainly just using the laugh emote, repeatedly gem flexing, or anything toxic like that. But again you can just ignore or report any suspicious activity. (plus most of the time these folks are young children)

The issues I have personally with this game is that, once you finish all your milestones and any current pass (which all of this can easily be done under 500 levels or even 350 levels if you are dedicated enough) there’s not much to do, the only things you can look forward to are events and new seasons. Or simply buying an archive pass and work on that, yet if you are a free to play player, this isnt an option for you to do. The only thing you can work for is having new gem colors and getting new breeds of animals, which is fine and I am currently doing this now- Yet the game doesn't reward you anything above 300 levels. Which inturn this game doesn't actually have much “longevity” towards it and this game only seem to update the SAW shop (place where you can spend ingame currency you buy with real money), barely any new updates towards the carl cart shop (in game currency for free players) unless a CC’s item you missed drops in the shop.

Cosmetics are wonderful on this game, These folks even take suggestions from the community and put them on the game (only discord) but my issue with it is that it can have a LONG waiting time to get a old item, as these folks do often put new cosmetics in shop every time a new season drops, yet this push back the rotation which in turn you have to wait a bit long or the increasing feeling of FOMO for the new item, because sometimes you have to wait HALF a year to get a damn item, so do you spend money on it now and not have money for an old item or you just wait AGAIN. On the Carl’s Cart from what I mentioned before doesn't have much dedication for it like the SAW shop.
Yet, I understand why due to them having to rely on cosmetics for monetization, yet it often feels like this said “free to play” game just sometimes kick FTP players to the curve and give them scraps of missed CC items and old event items from 3 years ago (which the last part is a new problem as in the past events ALL players can work for older event items but the new event layout, only gives the recent old items to super edition players)

But from my personal experiences, this game is addictive (as this game is the one I often play recently) and fun to play with friends, and even have new friends made along the way, I just said these negative parts to at least give you the recent taste of what's on this game. As well, I know the developers DO listen to their community and often try to improve. So I wish they listen to this one and take some notes. As I have discussed these problems with my CC friends and new players. This game is INSANELY fun and I am only discussing these with love. But, this is all I can say and thank you for reading-

Posted: March 16, 2020
One of two things are going to happen:

1) The other player or you is going to frantically run away.
2) The other player or you is going to curb stomp the other person.

There really isn't any in between. The fighting is not satisfying. The hamster balls have the jankiest physics and you will either hit someone a mile off or roll someone directly over and do nothing. The emu update was, quite frankly, pointless. The game is fun at first, but I can see why a chunk of their super content creators stopped playing.

Maybe that's a game for you. But it gets dull after having one unsatisfying game after another.




EDIT (April 4th, 2020):

I took a break from the game and tried it again after a while. My original thoughts on the game remain the same, but I want to make it clear:

This is not a bad game. I would not have put so much time into this game if it were not a good game. It really is a good game, and it's very disheartening that these feelings have come up for me. With a clearer head, I've been able to really narrow down the issues that I have with the game.

1) Vehicles. Yeah, the emus got nerfed since the original publishing of this review. Still feels ridiculous to go against them and to have them since you're essentially adding so many hit points to a player for free. But I think both Emus and Hamster Balls do not have a place in Super Animal Royale. You can outrun the skunk gas on foot easily enough. Ball hitboxes are still janky as hell, which I know is because of clientside ping. Still ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥.

2) Time to Kill. This is what makes me the most unsatisfied in the game, I believe. The time to kill (ttk) feels very, very short. Too short, in a lot of cases. Players can melt each other in a flash and there is no saving grace or anything about what just happened. I get that the game is about positioning and mobility. But sometimes I would like to have a longer gunfight with other players. Doesn't have to last over a minute, but when one or the other gets KO'd in less than a second? Doesn't feel fun to me at all, even if I'm the one doing the curb stomping.


Play the game. Enjoy the game. I highly, highly recommend playing the free version to try the game out and see if you like it. If you do enjoy it, buy the game. Heck, get the Founder's Edition - I think Pixile did a good job with this game. These are just the gripes of a sky pirate at this point, anyways.

EDIT (February 15th, 2021)

I can't play the game alone anymore. But I don't want people to shy away from the game. Give it a try, see if you like it. Maybe the game's gotten stale for me after the 600+ hours I've put into it. But I still catch myself getting on the game with friends.

Play it with your friends.

Posted: December 23, 2018
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
I'm not normally into "Battle Royale" style games but this top-down 2D spin on the genre has gotten my attention. In the typical Battle Royal fashion, you're one of 64 animals dropped onto an island where the end goal is to kill other the animals (and do the winner dance!) and your reward is 'DNA' to unlock other animal types to play as, different dances, and lots of cosmetic stuff to customize your animal. There's lots to unlock and it's all pretty random and you get access to more DNA drops as you level up also.

At present there's a solo mode, where you go into the match alone against 63 other players and bots, or you can team up with a buddy in Duo mode. There is a squad mode but it's not available until there is a high enough playerbase to support that mode. The devs have also included some pretty nefarious bots to deal with to fill up the matches if there aren't enough players. The game controls very well with a keyboard and mouse and reminds me of stuff like Hotline Miami and Nuclear Throne. Matches are quick, and the challenge of staying alive as the poison gas closes in on the island is thrilling as you run about collecting whatever you can to defeat the competition.

The art style is colorful and the animations are very smooth and the overall polish of the game is amazing. The sound effects are cute and remind me of the old WORMS games I used to play on the Playstation back in 1999, and the soundtrack itself is pretty fantastic. The developers are very active in communicating with the players about working on the game, some even play the game (they have blue names in-game) and I appreciate that a lot, and I can't wait to see what they add over time.

At first I was skeptical, due to the increase of radical B.R games, but after putting around 7 - 8 hours into this, I've fallen in love with it.

- The art-style is adorable, and it offers peaceful visuals mixed with an amazingly punchy and high-toned audio track.
- The game as well isn't pay to win at all, which is heaven on its own in today's world.
- Items in the game are random drops, or they're achievement oriented.
- The community is soft spoken and willing.

I genuinely can never be angry at this game, or the encounters I make in it as well.

* THE GAME AS A WHOLE *

- Offers little to no performance loss.
- Runs VERY well on all machines, and is dynamic.
- Graphics look amazing on low / high settings.
- Little to NO cheaters at all. I've never encountered one.
- Very fast-paced, and simple.
- Matchmaking time is amazing as well, something that a LOT of other B.R games can't offer. It takes around 3 - 4 seconds to find a new match.

EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
So yeah I just wanted to give my take on the game. It is pretty fun to play solo however if you have friends with the game the experience is more fun overall. Lots of nice people around, the staff are also pretty chill so feel free to chat in the lobby. Lots of unique drops you can get to make your character as unique as you'd like. Posted: August 6, 2019
EARLY ACCESS REVIEW
Honestly I don't know where to start. Typically I despise battle royale games. I've never enjoyed how tryhard-y and unenjoyable they can be and the communities never seem to be any good.

This is different. S.A.R is an absolutely amazing, yet simple game. It's like a parody that somehow outclasses the originals in every way. The gameplay is fun with a low skill floor and fairly high skill ceiling. Even losing match after match, I still find myself coming back, because win or not, the gameplay at it's core is balanced and polished to a degree I've rarely ever seen in games, it's so enjoyable and perfect for such a simple little game.

Not to mention it's charm, the game's artstyle is simple in a great way, everything looks relatively fresh and it's both eye catching and appealing without dragging your attention away from playing the game itself. The map is RIDDLED with little details you can spot mid-game and every one of the animals, whether you like them or not, is adorable.

Now one thing I will mention: If you genuinely hate furries, and have something against them, I wouldn't recommend this. This game draws them in like it's a safe haven, a majority of players you meet will be furs, and they make up a huge part of the community. That being said, this is one of if not the most pleasant, wholesome, genuinely nice and fun communities I have EVER seen in a game. Nobody is toxic, everybody is nice, and everybody is there to have fun.

Finally I'm going to add and say that the devs themselves are great. The game gets updated every few weeks or so with new content always flowing in, they're good, and active, and they care for the community.

TL;DR: It's REALLY damn good, nothing in the game costs money after initial purchase, constant updates, good community, GO BUY. NOW. WILL NOT REGRET. VERY WORTH.

Edit: Now with the super free edition! Seriously there's no reason not to at least give it a try now.

Posted: February 23, 2023
When a friend showed me this game, I thought to myself "Top-down Battle Royale? How on earth would that work?" And to my surprise, the devs made it work out incredibly. The top-down perspective combined with simpler controls (compared to other BR games) make this easily one of the best games of this genre for me.

On top of that, the game has an incredible charm to it, that, even if you die in the stupidest way possible, you sometimes can't help but laugh at the chain reactions that happen subsequently after your death. Of course, this is only something that can happen if you're not one to have their lid blown easily by the slightest puff.

The community is a mixed bag from what I've seen: newbies, sweats and everything in between, but nothing toxic to any extremes, at least in my time of playing.

The events, battle passes (dubbed animal passes) and achievement milestones are rather grindy, but they do reward clothing and weapon skins, which will let you style up your super animal to your liking.

All in all, a particularly great game. I just wish I could tell my past self to not judge a book by its cover...

Posted: April 3, 2020
I know I got like 10 hours on Pummel but I'm a Mario Party Expert

PROS:
- Fun to play with 4+ people
- Teaming up against one another (y'all gonna find out quick who your true friends are)
- Good for the price (I'd wait for the sale honestly)
- Graphics are fun and colorful, it pops out

CONS:
- Mini-games can get old and I swear there's a rotation of them and it's very selected
- Can get boring and repetitive after a certain time period playing the game
- Price is a lil high (even though it's only $15, I think $10 is more reasonable for the game)

CONSIDERATIONS:
- Add a BUY STORE (where you can use your keys you've gained throughout the game) to purchase weapons
- More maps with Killers roaming (Pummeltown is more fun because of the killer, unlike the other maps)
- More mini-games

OVERALL:
- 8/10 game FOR THE SALE PRICE
- It is truly a fun experience with friends and it gets a good laugh outta everyone
- Recommend it to a group of friends who wants to try something else besides playing Rainbow Six Siege, League of Legends, Apex Legends, COD, and Path of Exile every damn day <3

Posted: December 21, 2018
A PC game, with 4-player local co-op (full controller support), that is essentially a more mature version of Mario Party, that largely holds it's own! What's not to like!?! Whole heartedly recommend to anyone who wants party games on the PC.

A couple small Cons:
-Biggest complain is that several games should be longer. Who wants to play a mini-game that lasts less than 30 seconds? Or at least like 5 rounds instead of 1-3. (Mario party also suffers from this.) Or make it an option you can toggle in the menu?
-Controls in some of the games could be better.
-Not all of the games are amazing, but most are fun, if not great. (Mario Party also has some dud games.)

Very much looking forward to updates and eventually Pummel Party 2 one day!!!

Posted: September 25, 2018
I would would recommend this game, but would like to say that I likely would not play this game further until there are some changes.

Pros:
-The mini-games are extremely fun
-Rewards being good at the mini-games (maybe too much)
-Excellent friendship-ruining simulator

Cons:
-Not enough mini-games!!
-Reward system is kind of broken: first place gets the best items (swap, rocket) at a much higher rate making it extremely punishing
-No point in playing the elements mini-game until the last 5s as only the last crystal matters
-Keys have no use late-game --> needs balanceing, perhaps something to spend them on other than trophies (cannon doesnt count)
-Needs more items, probably more utiliy or no-damage items
-Maps could be bigger

While i do recommend this, changes need to be made to be recommendable beyond several hours. Overall fun, great with friends, and probably the best mario-party-like game out there right now. WOULD BE AMAZINGG WITH UPDATES!

Errors found at time of play:
-In the one 1v3 game, green was always the 1
-With turn order, ties were resolved with who was in the colour order
-->Notes:
-Small sample size
-could not be colour but number (ie. order of joining the lobby)
-experience is mainly with pirate map

Posted: December 4, 2019
This game is a looooooot of fun. I was impressed by the amount of minigames they had when I bought it, and they've added 20(?) more after that. There's 52 minigames right now (updating this when they add new) (EDIT: they've now added workshop support so you can make your own maps and minigames) Rebuilt Games is giving it a lot of love and attention still, and they listen to comments and attend to bugs.
You can play with 4-8 players BUT you can play by yourself and add 3 (or more) bots, no need to have 3 friends to enjoy it. You can even just add bots and watch them play without adding yourself, for some reason. The bots have 3 different difficulty settings. The bots work well and it's satisfying to play with them, although I've noticed them being allowed to cheat in a couple games.
There's a good diversity of maps that work in different ways, and the board-game side of the game is just as fun as the minigames to me. However, you can choose to only play with minigames if you want. (They've updated this now to support customizing your own maps in the workshop).
The minigames are very diverse, and they bring back some nostalgic memories of childhood games. If there's any games you don't really like you can remove them in the settings.
I know there's a local play option, but I haven't tried it yet. Online multiplayer works well, but lag can be a bit of a problem depending on your internet connection.
I really thoroughly enjoy this game, it always gives a good laugh.

Posted: November 23, 2020
Basically a more "mature" version of Mario Party. It's refreshing that the order of turns changes every round, depending on the placement in minigames and also a wider variety of items to use, mixing up gameplay. However, even though the minigames are mostly fun to play, it can be repetitive playing mini game after minigame each round, with nothing to spice up the gameplay in general (except for the occasional map changes activated by landing on a specific space). Most of the minigames are a free for all, and I would prefer minigames where there's 2v2 teams and more 3v1 minigames.

It's also nearly impossible to find online lobbies to play, so if you don't have any friends to play this game with, I advise not to purchase. I've only played this game in single player, and I believe that's how I'll mostly play it. The game's price isn't justified with what is offered in single player.

Since the game doesn't have many online lobbies to join, there should be a price cut to bring more traction, thus the possibility of more online lobbies.

Posted: August 2, 2023
I am a 55 year old biker and trucker father, and probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 15 now. My son got this game for from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 12 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he let me borrow his controller. Me and my son then played in turns and I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my son many happy memories.

Posted: August 30, 2019
***Updated at the end after playing with some updates, including the option allowing for end game bonus stars***

I skimmed some of the other reviews for the one, major complaint I have. And while it doesn't undo all of Pummel Party's great fun, it seriously hurts its long-term prospective.

Bonus stars.

If you're going to "copy" Mario Party's basic formula (and do it quite well, I assure) you are undermining the potential by allowing for too many anticlimactic finishes.
Too often have one of the players been a cup ahead, so to speak, that the final turn (or worse...final FEW) lacks any impact on the game's outcome.

All they need do is add in a customizable bonus star system similar to MP's. Further allow us to turn that feature on/off and everybody wins (for those of you who don't want/care about this aspect).

That one addition alone would make this a 10/10 experience. Add in a few more mini-games and an extra map or mode, and it would rival the King ;)

Lastly, if I'm being greedy, ;) I'd add in some sort of team game element. Either the 3v1 or 2v2 mini-game scenarios that MP does. Maybe the ability to see our mini-game score during the award screen, too (just so I can see how competitive or not I was during said mini-game). But these are not deal-breakers by any stretch.

Bonus stars could be...

***
The bonus star system was handled quite well. Allowing for some customization was a brilliant stroke and wholly appreciated.

I would tweak a couple of other things, but they are minor issues and would only improve quality of gamelife, and all.

Firstly, please add-somewhere on the screen- how many spaces the player has left upon reaching a crossroad. Sadly, I forget oftentimes how many spaces my toon has left to move. Counting those steps is crucial, at times.

Secondly, and far less important, might be, after a mini-game is done and the screen that showcases first through fourth place, leaving the game totals on screen. For instance, in a game that tallies kills, after the mini-game is over and the placing screen comes up, the kill totals are gone, off screen. It might be fun for us to get to discuss how close/dominant a particular score discrepancy is. Maybe not super important, but anything that encourages discussion of what just happened is a good thing in this type of game.

Thank you SO much for the work, thus far. This game is really going somewhere!

Overall this game is a lot of fun to play has a lot of potential to be the better party game over MP but only if they keep adding content to the game.

Posted: April 15
Pummel Party is a multiplayer game with similarities to Mario Party. Like Mario Party, you roll the dice to move across the board, play mini-games, and try to collect the most stars to win. The game can be played with friends, random people online, or AI. There are different mini-games where you shoot each other, knock each other off cliffs, and many other activities.

It's all in good fun, but the biggest difference between Pummel Party and Mario Party is the level of violence. Pummel Party has blood, guts, and carnage, making it more suitable for adults. The graphics are reasonable, and there are plenty of customization options. The game is straightforward and doesn't require a complicated rulebook. It's a party game, and it's best played with friends who are willing to get hammered online for several hours. During hosting or joining games, I never experienced any disconnects or crashes. It's a fun solid title.

Posted: September 21, 2018
This game when i first saw it Fusion Frenzy came to mind. Now its obviously not that same, it is different from Fusion and other party/minigame options out there with the boardgame mode. The way the boardgame mode is done is so fun and semmingly well thought out. You have your main objective to win which is to obatin as many trophies as possible before you run out of turns. Turns work in rounds, at the start you roll to see who goes first then after everyone has had their turn you play a minigame. Depending on how you place in the random minigame you get that dictate when you will go on the boardgame. (if you get 1st place in the minigame you get to go first etc..).

My only issues is i just wish there was more than 4 players

It's Mario Party for the PC. I could go more in-depth about the minigames and stuff but that's honestly all you need to know.

I'm glad that the devs chose not to abandon the game and instead expanded on it. New minigames, new maps, and especially mod support for custom minigames push its replayability by a lot. It's really telling that me and my friends came back to this game almost 2 years later and had just as much fun as our pandemic sessions.

My main gripe with the game is how it handles disconnects, or rather how it DOESN'T handle disconnects. When you or your friend disconnects, that's it. They can't reconnect. It sucks, and is a problem since the game's launch that they still haven't addressed.

Posted: March 26, 2022
This game saved my life.

I am 69.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiralling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

Posted: December 4, 2023
Pummel Party is a great game where you can have fun with both AI bots and your friends (highly recommended). To put it briefly, it is a board game in which you progress by rolling dice on several different maps and decide who will roll the dice first in each hand, in the minigame you play at the end of the previous hand.

Let me explain a little more:

+ You decide with the dice who will start the first hand. (numbers on the dice: 1-9)
+ The aim of the game is to win as many trophies as the target when setting up the room.
+ You must collect 40 keys for each trophy and go to a specific chest on the map to get it. If you don't have enough keys, you can't open the chest.
+ Each character has 30 health. They created this so that you can eliminate your competitors. If you die, you are reborn at the re-spawn point. (There are also separate items on the board, I talk about them below)
+ A random minigame opens after each hand is finished.
Minigame: These are small games that are logically derived from arcade and PC games such as bomberman, quidditch, fps, tanks, etc. and are very fun and end quickly.
+ When you return to the board game you are playing, in addition to beating your opponents with dice, there are items you can use if you are within sufficient range. (e.g. you can inflict 30hp damage to your opponent with boxing gloves, or you can use a portal to replace yourself and another opponent, and there is even a HP box as an item that you can use when your health is low)
But lastly, you can fight with some of your friends after this game. haha

Posted: April 21, 2023
Pummel Party is a Mario Party-type party game. It is one of those games that you see Youtubers playing for a bit and then fading out of existence. That is the sad fate of a wide variety of party games if they even get the chance to have their short time in the Youtube spotlight. Despite this game actually being really good, it, unfortunately, fell to this all-too-common fate.

The overall experience of playing this game is incredibly enjoyable, thanks to its well-crafted gameplay, charming art style, and surprisingly good music. When it comes to gameplay, the game excels in all areas, from its well-designed minigames to its diverse boards and engaging items. Compared to the ever-popular Mario Party series, this game stands out as a more fun and polished experience.

One of the highlights of the game is the minigames, which are not only numerous but also expertly crafted. They are varied enough to keep things interesting, and they provide a nice balance of challenge and fun. The boards are also well thought out, offering different gameplay mechanics and obstacles that require players to use different strategies to win. The items outside of the minigames add an extra layer of depth to the gameplay, allowing players to gain advantages over their opponents or affect the game in different ways.

Moving on to the music, it is a pleasant surprise that adds to the overall experience. While it may not be something that players would listen to outside of the game, it does a fantastic job of setting the mood and creating an immersive atmosphere. It complements the gameplay well and helps to immerse players in the world of the game.

The art style is simple yet effective, and it perfectly suits the kind of game it is. The art style does not distract from the gameplay but rather enhances it by allowing players to focus on the gameplay mechanics and the objectives. It's a great stylistic choice that contributes to the overall charm and appeal of the game.

Overall, this is a good variation of a Mario Party-type party game. It does many things better than normal Mario Party but fails in having proper recognition and traction. I would recommend this game, but only if you have a group of friends to play it with. If you don't have a group of friends to play this with, then there are probably better options out there for you.

Posted: July 1, 2023
Pummel Party is an evolution of the Mario Party formula. Finally the turn order isn't decided right at the start but after every minigame which makes the minigames even more important. As a player you can customise a lot of the settings like which items are allowed, which minigames can be selected, which special trophies should be distributed and many more.
With this customisation, Pummel Party can be the adult version but can be family friendly as well if you turn off blood effects and maybe some minigames.
The AI can be really good in some minigames but in others they are slightly overpowered. But at least you can select the difficulty level of them as well.
By adding health to the players, it can get really intense and fun, because your friends can hurt you with their items and kill you which ends in losing a lot of your keys and respawning on some dedicated points on the map.
The maps also have a great variety with a Christmas, Halloween, pirate, desert, space and forest-temple setting. Each map has special features like a killer hunting for pray at the end of the round or changing direction if a player activates a certain type of space.
These features make the maps feel unique in their own way.

But the most important aspect of this game is the new implemented mod editor. You need to keep in mind that the editor is still in beta, so some bugs can appear in mods and not every feature mentioned above is possible right now. But I have spend a lot of time in the editor and I have to say it makes so much fun creating your own maps and minigames. The editor is also really intuitive and you don't need to learn a lot to use it efficiently. Furthermore a nice community has evolved around the editor. After just seven months, in total the workshop has already 450 minigames and 402 maps for you to explore (of course some of them are not so great, but there are many maps and minigames that have gotten a lot of effort by the creators and you can find hidden gems in the workshop) and of course some Mario Party contend has already been created.
And despite the developers being a bit quiet with the community (I hope that will change soon), I am convinced that the editor will keep the game alive for a long time. So please support mod editors that are creating great contend for all of you for free.

That was a brief list of aspects why I think that Pummel Party is the best Mario Party game out there and I would definitely recommend you buying it and enjoying the rage of your friends when you kill them with an eggplant.

I absolutely love ibb & obb so I just wanted to write a short review for those who are interested in getting this fantastic game! ♥

PROS
Genuinely amazing and challenging puzzle platformer (IMO: Difficulty spiked about halfway through the game.)
Visually stunning with its cutesy art (How can anyone resist the cuteness of ibb & obb! And the beautiful scenery! It just makes me want to take a screenshot every few seconds.)

Easy controls - all you can do is jump, run, walk, and draw!

CONS
Continuous lag during online co-op, particularly when I played the last level; the final boss glitched badly for my partner and I, which made the game a little bit frustrating but still fun
No clear storyline and narrative; players simply choose between playing the smaller green ibb or the taller pink obb and get to the end of each level by solving puzzles!

Review by Games for Lovers - only GOOD local co-op games!

You want to play something with your significant other?

This cute side-scrolling jump'n run will have you solving gravity-based puzzles while enjoying the brightly colored world. You and your SO play as the titular ibb and obb, two little creatures trying to reach the level exit together.

TLDR: Great coop puzzle platformer, totally recommended.


POSITIVE
- It's very easy to get into, and fun to play.
- Great minimalistic artstyle, smooth controls and platforming. Good music.
